member.summary: Specifies whether the Sidebar need to be closed or not when document area is clicked.

member.summary: Specifies the size of the Sidebar in dock state. > For more details about dockSize refer to [`Dock`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/docking-sidebar/) documentation.

member.summary: Specifies the docking state of the component. > For more details about enableDock refer to [`Dock`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/docking-sidebar/) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Sidebar.EnableGestures
member.summary: Enables the expand or collapse while swiping in touch devices.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Sidebar.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. Position 2. Type

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Sidebar.EnableRtl
member.summary: Specifies the Sidebar in RTL mode that displays the content in the right-to-left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Sidebar.IsOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets the Sidebar component is open or close. > When the Sidebar type is set to `Auto`, the component will be expanded in the desktop and collapsed in the mobile mode regardless of the isOpen property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Sidebar.MediaQuery
member.summary:
Specifies the media query string for resolution, which when met opens the Sidebar.
> For more details about mediaQuery refer to [`Auto Close`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/auto-close/) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Sidebar.Position
member.summary: Specifies the position of the Sidebar (Left/Right) corresponding to the main content. > For more details about SidebarPosition refer to [`position`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/getting-started/#position) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Sidebar.ShowBackdrop
member.summary: Specifies the whether to apply overlay options to main content when the Sidebar is in an open state. > For more details about showBackdrop refer to [`Backdrop`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/getting-started/#enable-backdrop) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Sidebar.Target
member.summary: Allows to place the sidebar inside the target element. > For more details about target refer to [`Custom Context`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/sidebar/custom-context/) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Sidebar.Type
member.summary: Specifies the expanding types of the Sidebar. `Over` - The sidebar floats over the main content area. `Push` - The sidebar pushes the main content area to appear side-by-side, and shrinks the main content within the screen width. `Slide` - The sidebar translates the x and y positions of main content area based on the sidebar width. The main content area will not be adjusted within the screen width. `Auto` - Sidebar with `Over` type in mobile resolution and `Push` type in other higher resolutions. > For more details about SidebarType refer to [`SidebarType`](./variations.html#types) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Sidebar.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Sidebar. By default, the width of the Sidebar sets based on the size of its content. Width can also be set in pixel values.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Sidebar.ZIndex
member.summary: Specifies the z-index of the Sidebar. It is applicable only when sidebar act as overlay type.

member.summary: Triggers when the state(expand/collapse) of the component is changed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TabHeader.IconCss
member.summary: Specifies the icon class that is used to render an icon in the Tab header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TabHeader.IconPosition
member.summary: Options for positioning the icon in the Tab item header. This property depends on `iconCss` property. The possible values are: - Left: Places the icon to the `left` of the item. - Top: Places the icon on the `top` of the item. - Right: Places the icon to the `right` end of the item. - Bottom: Places the icon at the `bottom` of the item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TabHeader.Text
member.summary: Specifies the display text of the Tab item header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TabHeader.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.Animation
member.summary: Specifies the animation configuration settings while showing the content of the Tab.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.CssClass
member.summary: Sets the CSS classes to root element of the Tab that helps to customize component styles.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. selectedItem

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.HeaderPlacement
member.summary: Specifies the orientation of Tab header. The possible values are: - Top: Places the Tab header on the top. - Bottom: Places the Tab header at the bottom. - Left: Places the Tab header on the left. - Right: Places the Tab header at the right.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the Tab component. By default, Tab height is set based on the height of its parent. To use height property, heightAdjustMode must be set to 'None'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.HeightAdjustMode
member.summary: Specifies the height style for Tab content. The possible values are: - None: Based on the given height property, the content panel height is set. - Auto: Tallest panel height of a given Tab content is set to all the other panels. - Content: Based on the corresponding content height, the content panel height is set. - Fill: Based on the parent height, the content panel height is set.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.Items
member.summary: An array of object that is used to configure the Tab component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the Tab display mode when Tab content exceeds the viewing area. The possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements are displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Tab container holds the items that can be placed within the available space and rest of the items are moved to the popup. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements can be viewed by scrolling the popup.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.ScrollStep
member.summary: Specifies the scrolling distance in scroller.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Tab.SelectedItem
member.summary: Specifies the index for activating the current Tab item.

member.summary: Specifies the width of the Tab component. Default, Tab width sets based on the width of its parent.

member.summary: Specifies the height of the Tab component. By default, Tab height is set based on the height of its parent. To use height property, heightAdjustMode must be set to 'None'.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TabBuilder.HeightAdjustMode(Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.HeightStyles)
member.summary: Specifies the height style for Tab content. The possible values are: - None: Based on the given height property, the content panel height is set. - Auto: Tallest panel height of a given Tab content is set to all the other panels. - Content: Based on the corresponding content height, the content panel height is set. - Fill: Based on the parent height, the content panel height is set.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TabBuilder.OverflowMode(Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.OverflowMode)
member.summary: Specifies the Tab display mode when Tab content exceeds the viewing area. The possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements are displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Tab container holds the items that can be placed within the available space and rest of the items are moved to the popup. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements can be viewed by scrolling the popup.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Align
member.summary: Specifies the location for aligning Toolbar items on the Toolbar. Each command will be aligned according to the `align` property. Possible values are: - Left: To align commands to the left side of the Toolbar. - Center: To align commands at the center of the Toolbar. - Right: To align commands to the right side of the Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.CssClass
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes (separated by space) to be used for customization of commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Defines htmlAttributes used to add custom attributes to Toolbar command. Supports HTML attributes such as style, class, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Id
member.summary: Specifies the unique ID to be used with button or input element of Toolbar items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Overflow
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar command display area when an element's content is too large to fit available space. This is applicable only to `popup` mode. Possible values are: - Show: Always shows the item as the primary priority on the Toolbar. - Hide: Always shows the item as the secondary priority on the popup. - None: No priority for display, and as per normal order moves to popup when content exceeds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.PrefixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned before the text content if text is available, otherwise the icon alone will be rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ShowAlwaysInPopup
member.summary: Defines the priority of items to display it in popup always. It allows to maintain toolbar item on popup always but it does not work for toolbar priority items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.ShowTextOn
member.summary: Specifies where the button text will be displayed on popup mode of the Toolbar. Possible values are: - Toolbar: Text will be displayed on Toolbar only. - Overflow: Text will be displayed only when content overflows to popup. - Both: Text will be displayed on popup and Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.SuffixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned after the text content if text is available.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Template
member.summary: Specifies the HTML element/element ID as a string that can be added as a Toolbar command.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Text
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.TooltipText
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ToolbarItem.Type
member.summary: Specifies the types of command to be rendered in the Toolbar. Supported types are: - Button: Creates the Button control with its given properties like text, prefixIcon, etc. - Separator: Adds a horizontal line that separates the Toolbar commands. - Input: Creates an input element that is applicable to template rendering with Syncfusion controls like DropDownList, AutoComplete, etc.

member.summary: Specifies the width of the Toolbar button commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.Toolbar.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar display mode when Toolbar content exceeds the viewing area. Possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements are displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Prioritized elements are displayed on the Toolbar and the rest of elements are moved to the popup. - MultiRow: Displays the overflow toolbar items as an in-line of a toolbar. - Extended: Hide the overflowing toolbar items in the next row. Show the overflowing toolbar items when you click the expand icons. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements will be hidden.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.AllowDragAndDrop
member.summary: Indicates whether the TreeView allows drag and drop of nodes. To drag and drop a node in desktop, hold the mouse on the node, drag it to the target node and drop the node by releasing the mouse. For touch devices, drag and drop operation is performed by touch, touch move and touch end. For more information on drag and drop nodes concept, refer to [Drag and Drop](../../treeview/drag-and-drop/).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.AllowEditing
member.summary: Enables or disables editing of the text in the TreeView node. When `allowEditing` property is set to true, the TreeView allows you to edit the node by double clicking the node or by navigating to the node and pressing F2 key. For more information on node editing, refer to [Node Editing](../../treeview/node-editing/).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.AllowMultiSelection
member.summary: Enables or disables multi-selection of nodes. To select multiple nodes: Select the nodes by holding down the CTRL key while clicking on the nodes. Select consecutive nodes by clicking the first node to select and hold down the SHIFT key and click the last node to select.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.Animation
member.summary: Specifies the type of animation applied on expanding and collapsing the nodes along with duration.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.AutoCheck
member.summary: Allow us to specify the parent and child nodes to get auto check while we check or uncheck a node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.CheckedNodes
member.summary: The `checkedNodes` property is used to set the nodes that need to be checked or get the ID of nodes that are currently checked in the TreeView component. The `checkedNodes` property depends upon the value of `showCheckBox` property. For more information on checkedNodes, refer to [checkedNodes](../../treeview/check-box#checked-nodes).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS classes to be added with root element of the TreeView to help customize the appearance of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enables or disables persisting TreeView state between page reloads. If enabled, following APIs will persist. 1. `selectedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are selected in the TreeView component. 2. `checkedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are checked in the TreeView component. 3. `expandedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are expanded in the TreeView component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.ExpandOn
member.summary: Specifies the action on which the node expands or collapses. The available actions are, `Auto` - In desktop, the expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click the node, and in mobile devices it happens on single-click. `Click` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you single-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `DblClick` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `None` - The expand/collapse operation will not happen when you single-click or double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.ExpandedNodes
member.summary: Represents the expanded nodes in the TreeView component. We can set the nodes that need to be expanded or get the ID of the nodes that are currently expanded by using this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.Fields
member.summary: Specifies the data source and mapping fields to render TreeView nodes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.FullRowSelect
member.summary: On enabling this property, the entire row of the TreeView node gets selected by clicking a node. When disabled only the corresponding node's text gets selected. For more information on Fields concept, refer to [Fields](../../treeview/data-binding#local-data).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.LoadOnDemand
member.summary: By default, the load on demand (Lazy load) is set to true. By disabling this property, all the tree nodes are rendered at the beginning itself.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.NodeTemplate
member.summary: Specifies a template to render customized content for all the nodes. If the `nodeTemplate` property is set, the template content overrides the displayed node text. The property accepts template string [template string](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/base/template-engine.html) or HTML element ID holding the content. For more information on template concept, refer to [Template](../../treeview/template/).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.SelectedNodes
member.summary: Represents the selected nodes in the TreeView component. We can set the nodes that need to be selected or get the ID of the nodes that are currently selected by using this property. On enabling `allowMultiSelection` property we can select multiple nodes and on disabling it we can select only a single node. For more information on selectedNodes, refer to [selectedNodes](../../treeview/multiple-selection#selected-nodes).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.ShowCheckBox
member.summary: Indicates that the nodes will display CheckBoxes in the TreeView. The CheckBox will be displayed next to the expand/collapse icon of the node. For more information on CheckBoxes, refer to [CheckBox](../../treeview/check-box/).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeView.SortOrder
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the nodes are sorted in the ascending or descending order, or are not sorted at all. The available types of sort order are, `None` - The nodes are not sorted. `Ascending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order. `Descending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order.

member.summary: Triggers when the TreeView control is created successfully.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewActionSettingsBuilder.Duration(System.Double)
member.summary: Specifies the duration to animate.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewActionSettingsBuilder.Easing(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the animation timing function.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewActionSettingsBuilder.Effect(System.Object)
member.summary: Specifies the type of animation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.HtmlAttributes(System.Object)
member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.AllowDragAndDrop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Indicates whether the TreeView allows drag and drop of nodes. To drag and drop a node in desktop, hold the mouse on the node, drag it to the target node and drop the node by releasing the mouse. For touch devices, drag and drop operation is performed by touch, touch move and touch end. For more information on drag and drop nodes concept, refer to [Drag and Drop](../../treeview/drag-and-drop/).

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.AllowEditing(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables editing of the text in the TreeView node. When `allowEditing` property is set to true, the TreeView allows you to edit the node by double clicking the node or by navigating to the node and pressing F2 key. For more information on node editing, refer to [Node Editing](../../treeview/node-editing/).

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.AllowMultiSelection(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables multi-selection of nodes. To select multiple nodes: Select the nodes by holding down the CTRL key while clicking on the nodes. Select consecutive nodes by clicking the first node to select and hold down the SHIFT key and click the last node to select.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.Animation(Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewNodeAnimationSettings)
member.summary: Specifies the type of animation applied on expanding and collapsing the nodes along with duration.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.AutoCheck(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allow us to specify the parent and child nodes to get auto check while we check or uncheck a node.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.CheckedNodes(System.String[])
member.summary: The `checkedNodes` property is used to set the nodes that need to be checked or get the ID of nodes that are currently checked in the TreeView component. The `checkedNodes` property depends upon the value of `showCheckBox` property. For more information on checkedNodes, refer to [checkedNodes](../../treeview/check-box#checked-nodes).

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.CssClass(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the CSS classes to be added with root element of the TreeView to help customize the appearance of the component.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.EnablePersistence(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables persisting TreeView state between page reloads. If enabled, following APIs will persist. 1. `selectedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are selected in the TreeView component. 2. `checkedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are checked in the TreeView component. 3. `expandedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are expanded in the TreeView component.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.EnableRtl(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.TreeViewBuilder.ExpandOn(Syncfusion.EJ2.Navigations.ExpandOnSettings)
member.summary: Specifies the action on which the node expands or collapses. The available actions are, `Auto` - In desktop, the expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click the node, and in mobile devices it happens on single-click. `Click` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you single-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `DblClick` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `None` - The expand/collapse operation will not happen when you single-click or double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices.

Custom: Displays the legend based on the given x and y values.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.AccumulationSeries.LegendShape
member.summary: The shape of the legend. Each series has its own legend shape. They are Circle - Renders a circle. Rectangle - Renders a rectangle. Triangle - Renders a triangle. Diamond - Renders a diamond. Cross - Renders a cross. HorizontalLine - Renders a horizontalLine. VerticalLine - Renders a verticalLine. Pentagon - Renders a pentagon. InvertedTriangle - Renders a invertedTriangle. SeriesType -Render a legend shape based on series type.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartAxis.LabelFormat
member.summary: Used to format the axis label that accepts any global string format like 'C', 'n1', 'P' etc. It also accepts placeholder like '{value}C' in which value represent the axis label, e.g, 20C.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartAxis.LabelIntersectAction
member.summary: Specifies the actions like `None`, `Hide`, `Trim`, `Wrap`, `MultipleRows`, `Rotate45`, and `Rotate90` when the axis labels intersect with each other.They are, None: Shows all the labels. Hide: Hides the label when it intersects. Trim: Trim the label when it intersects. Wrap: Wrap the label when it intersects. MultipleRows: Shows the label in MultipleRows when it intersects. Rotate45: Rotates the label to 45 degree when it intersects. Rotate90: Rotates the label to 90 degree when it intersects.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartAxisBuilder.LabelIntersectAction(Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.LabelIntersectAction)
member.summary: Specifies the actions like `None`, `Hide`, `Trim`, `Wrap`, `MultipleRows`, `Rotate45`, and `Rotate90` when the axis labels intersect with each other.They are, None: Shows all the labels. Hide: Hides the label when it intersects. Trim: Trim the label when it intersects. Wrap: Wrap the label when it intersects. MultipleRows: Shows the label in MultipleRows when it intersects. Rotate45: Rotates the label to 45 degree when it intersects. Rotate90: Rotates the label to 90 degree when it intersects.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.SelectionMode
member.summary: Defines the SelectionMode, They are. none - Disable the selection. series - To select a series. point - To select a point. cluster - To select a cluster of point dragXY - To select points, by dragging with respect to both horizontal and vertical axis dragX - To select points, by dragging with respect to horizontal axis. dragY - To select points, by dragging with respect to vertical axis. lasso - To select points, by dragging with respect to free form.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartTheme
member.summary: Defines Theme of the chart. They are Material - Render a chart with Material theme. Fabric - Render a chart with Fabric theme

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.BoxPlotMode
member.summary: Defines the BoxPlotMode for box and whisker chart series, They are. exclusive - Series render based on exclusive mode. inclusive - Series render based on inclusive mode. normal - Series render based on normal mode.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartDrawType
member.summary: Type of series to be drawn in radar or polar series. They are line - Renders the line series. column - Renders the column series. area - Renders the area series. scatter - Renders the scatter series. spline - Renders the spline series. stackingColumn - Renders the stacking column series. stackingArea - Renders the stacking area series. rangeColumn - Renders the range column series. splineArea - Renders the spline area series.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.LegendShape
member.summary: Defines the shape of legend. They are circle - Renders a circle. rectangle - Renders a rectangle. triangle - Renders a triangle. diamond - Renders a diamond. cross - Renders a cross. horizontalLine - Renders a horizontalLine. verticalLine - Renders a verticalLine. pentagon - Renders a pentagon. invertedTriangle - Renders a invertedTriangle. SeriesType -Render a legend shape based on series type.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.Segment
member.summary: Defines the segment axis. They are, X - Segment calculation rendered based on horizontal axis Y - Segment calculation rendered based on vertical axis

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.SplineType
member.summary: It defines type of spline. Natural - Used to render Natural spline. Cardinal - Used to render cardinal spline. Clamped - Used to render Clamped spline Monotonic - Used to render monotonic spline

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartSeriesType
member.summary: Defines the type series in chart. They are line - Renders the line series. column - Renders the column series. area - Renders the area series. pie - Renders the pie series. polar - Renders the polar series. radar - Renders the radar series. bar - Renders the stacking column series histogram - Renders the histogram series stackingColumn - Renders the stacking column series. stackingArea - Renders the stacking area series. stackingLine - Renders the stacking line series. stackingBar - Renders the stacking bar series. StackingColumn100 - Renders the stacking column series. StackingArea100 - Renders the stacking area 100 percent series stackingLine100 - Renders the stacking line 100 percent series. StackingBar100 - Renders the stacking bar 100 percent series. stepLine - Renders the step line series. stepArea - Renders the step area series. scatter - Renders the scatter series. spline - Renders the spline series rangeColumn - Renders the rangeColumn series. hilo - Renders the hilo series hiloOpenClose - Renders the HiloOpenClose Series Waterfall - Renders the Waterfall Series rangeArea - Renders the rangeArea series. Pareto-Render the Pareto series

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.TrendlineTypes
member.summary: Defines the type of trendlines. They are Linear - Defines the linear trendline Exponential - Defines the exponential trendline Polynomial - Defines the polynomial trendline Power - Defines the power trendline Logarithmic - Defines the logarithmic trendline MovingAverage - Defines the moving average trendline

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartShape
member.summary: Defines the shape of marker. They are circle - Renders a circle. rectangle - Renders a rectangle. triangle - Renders a triangle. diamond - Renders a diamond. cross - Renders a cross. horizontalLine - Renders a horizontalLine. verticalLine - Renders a verticalLine. pentagon- Renders a pentagon. invertedTriangle - Renders a invertedTriangle. image - Renders a image.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.Alignment
member.summary: Defines the Alignment. They are near - Align the element to the left. center - Align the element to the center. far - Align the element to the right.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.LabelPosition
member.summary: Defines the LabelPosition, They are. outer - Position the label outside the point. top - Position the label on top of the point. bottom - Position the label on bottom of the point. middle - Position the label to middle of the point. auto - Position the label based on series.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.TextOverflow
member.summary: Defines the Text overflow. None - Shown the chart title with overlap if exceed. Wrap - Shown the chart title with wrap if exceed. Trim - Shown the chart title with trim if exceed.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ErrorBarDirection
member.summary: Defines the direction of error bar. They are both - Renders both direction of error bar. minus - Renders minus direction of error bar. plus - Renders plus direction error bar.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ErrorBarMode
member.summary: Defines the modes of error bar. They are vertical - Renders a vertical error bar. horizontal - Renders a horizontal error bar. both - Renders both side error bar.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ErrorBarType
member.summary: Defines the type of error bar. They are fixed - Renders a fixed type error bar. percentage - Renders a percentage type error bar. standardDeviation - Renders a standard deviation type error bar. standardError -Renders a standard error type error bar. custom -Renders a custom type error bar.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.EmptyPointMode
member.summary: Defines the empty point mode of the chart. Gap - Used to display empty points as space. Zero - Used to display empty points as zero. Drop - Used to ignore the empty point while rendering. Average - Used to display empty points as previous and next point average.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.AccEmptyPointMode
member.summary: Defines the empty point mode of the chart. Zero - Used to display empty points as zero. Drop - Used to ignore the empty point while rendering. Average - Used to display empty points as previous and next point average.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.EdgeLabelPlacement
member.summary: Defines the Edge Label Placement for an axis. They are none - No action will be perform. hide - Edge label will be hidden. shift - Shift the edge labels.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.IntervalType
member.summary: Defines the interval type of datetime axis. They are auto - Define the interval of the axis based on data. years - Define the interval of the axis in years. months - Define the interval of the axis in months. days - Define the interval of the axis in days. hours - Define the interval of the axis in hours. minutes - Define the interval of the axis in minutes.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.LabelIntersectAction
member.summary: Defines the Alignment. They are none - Shows all the labels. hide - Hide the label when it intersect. rotate45 - Rotate the label to 45 degree when it intersect. rotate90 - Rotate the label to 90 degree when it intersect.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.LabelPlacement
member.summary: Defines the Label Placement for category axis. They are betweenTicks - Render the label between the ticks. onTicks - Render the label on the ticks.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.AxisPosition
member.summary: Defines the Position. They are inside - Place the ticks or labels inside to the axis line. outside - Place the ticks or labels outside to the axis line.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ChartRangePadding
member.summary: Defines the range padding of axis. They are none - Padding cannot be applied to the axis. normal - Padding is applied to the axis based on the range calculation. additional - Interval of the axis is added as padding to the minimum and maximum values of the range. round - Axis range is rounded to the nearest possible value divided by the interval.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.SkeletonType
member.summary: Defines the skeleton type for the axis. Date - it formats date only. DateTime - it formats date and time. Time - it formats time only.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ValueType
member.summary: Defines the type of axis. They are double - Renders a numeric axis. dateTime - Renders a dateTime axis. category - Renders a category axis. logarithmic - Renders a log axis. DateTimeCategory - Renders a datetime DateTimeCategory axis

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.Anchor
member.summary: Defines the strip line text position. Start - Places the strip line text at the start. Middle - Places the strip line text in the middle. End - Places the strip line text at the end.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.SizeType
member.summary: Defines the unit of Strip line Size. They are auto pixel year month day hour minutes seconds

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ZIndex
member.summary: Specifies the order of the strip line. `Over` | `Behind`. Over - Places the strip line over the series elements. Behind - laces the strip line behind the series elements.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.BorderType
member.summary: Defines border type for multi level labels. Rectangle Brace WithoutBorder Without top Border Without top and bottom border Curly brace

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.Units
member.summary: Defines Coordinate units of an annotation. They are Pixel Point

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.Regions
member.summary: Defines regions of an annotation. They are Chart Series

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.Position
member.summary: Defines the Position. They are top - Align the element to the top. middle - Align the element to the center. bottom - Align the element to the bottom.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.FinancialDataFields
member.summary: Defines the financial data fields High - Represents the highest price in the stocks over time Low - Represents the lowest price in the stocks over time Open - Represents the opening price in the stocks over time Close - Represents the closing price in the stocks over time

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.TechnicalIndicators
member.summary: Defines the type of technical indicators. They are Sma - Predicts the trend using Simple Moving Average approach Ema - Predicts the trend using Exponential Moving Average approach Tma - Predicts the trend using Triangle Moving Average approach Atr - Predicts the trend using Average True Range approach AccumulationDistribution - Predicts the trend using Accumulation Distribution approach Momentum - Predicts the trend using Momentum approach Rsi - Predicts the trend using RSI approach Macd - Predicts the trend using Moving Average Convergence Divergence approach Stochastic - Predicts the trend using Stochastic approach BollingerBands - Predicts the trend using Bollinger approach

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ConnectorType
member.summary: Defines the ConnectorType. They are Line - Accumulation series Connector line type as Straight line. Curve - Accumulation series Connector line type as Curved line.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.LineType
member.summary: Defines the mode of line in crosshair. They are none - Hides both vertical and horizontal crosshair line. both - Shows both vertical and horizontal crosshair line. vertical - Shows the vertical line. horizontal - Shows the horizontal line.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.LegendPosition
member.summary: Defines the position of the legend. They are auto - Places the legend based on area type. top - Displays the legend on the top of chart. left - Displays the legend on the left of chart. bottom - Displays the legend on the bottom of chart. right - Displays the legend on the right of chart. custom - Displays the legend based on given x and y value.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.ZoomMode
member.summary: Defines the zooming mode, They are. x,y - Chart will be zoomed with respect to both vertical and horizontal axis. x - Chart will be zoomed with respect to horizontal axis. y - Chart will be zoomed with respect to vertical axis.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.AccumulationSelectionMode
member.summary: Defines the SelectionMode, They are. none - Disable the selection. point - To select a point.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.AccumulationTheme
member.summary: Defines Theme of the accumulation chart. They are Material - Render a accumulation chart with Material theme. Fabric - Render a accumulation chart with fabric theme.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.GroupModes
member.summary: Defines the mode of the group mode Point - When choosing points, the selected points get grouped. Value - When choosing values, the points which less then values get grouped.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.PyramidModes
member.summary: Defines the mode of the pyramid Linear - Height of the pyramid segments reflects the values Surface - Surface/Area of the pyramid segments reflects the values

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.AccumulationType
member.summary: Defines the Accumulation Chart series type.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.AccumulationLabelPosition
member.summary: Defines the AccumulationLabelPosition. They are Inside - Define the data label position for the accumulation series Inside. Outside - Define the data label position for the accumulation series Outside.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.RangeIntervalType

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.RangeLabelIntersectAction

Minutes: Defines the interval of the axis in minutes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.StockChartStockChartAxis.LabelIntersectAction

Years: Defines the interval of the axis in years. Months: Defines the interval of the axis in months. Days: Defines the interval of the axis in days. Hours: Defines the interval of the axis in hours. Minutes: Defines the interval of the axis in minutes.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.StockChartStockChartAxisBuilder.LabelIntersectAction(Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.LabelIntersectAction)
member.summary: Specifies the actions like `Hide`, `Rotate45`, and `Rotate90` when the axis labels intersect with each other.They are, None: Shows all the labels. Hide: Hides the label when it intersects. Rotate45: Rotates the label to 45 degree when it intersects. Rotate90: Rotates the label to 90 degree when it intersects.

member.summary: Specifies whether to allow zooming vertically or horizontally or in both ways. They are, x,y: Chart can be zoomed both vertically and horizontally. x: Chart can be zoomed horizontally. y: Chart can be zoomed vertically. It requires `enableSelectionZooming` to be true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Charts.StockChartZoomSettings.ToolbarItems
member.summary: Specifies the toolkit options for the zooming as follows: Zoom ZoomIn ZoomOut Pan Reset

member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.summary: Specifies whether to display the floating label above the input element. Possible values are: Never: The label will never float in the input when the placeholder is available. member.summary: Specifies whether to show or hide the clear button. When the clear button is clicked, `value`, `text`, and `index` properties are reset to null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBox.SortOrder
member.summary: Specifies the `sortOrder` to sort the data source. The available type of sort orders are `None` - The data source is not sorting. `Ascending` - The data source is sorting with ascending order. `Descending` - The data source is sorting with descending order.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBoxBuilder.AllowCustom(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies whether the component allows user defined value which does not exist in data source.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBoxBuilder.AllowFiltering(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When allowFiltering is set to true, show the filter bar (search box) of the component. The filter action retrieves matched items through the `filtering` event based on the characters typed in the search TextBox. If no match is found, the value of the `noRecordsTemplate` property will be displayed.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.ComboBoxBuilder.Autofill(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies whether suggest a first matched item in input when searching. No action happens when no matches found.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.FloatLabelType(Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.FloatLabelType)
member.summary: Specifies whether to display the floating label above the input element. Possible values are: Never: The label will never float in the input when the placeholder is available. Always: The floating label will always float above the input. Auto: The floating label will float above the input after focusing or entering a value in the input.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.GroupTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the group headers present in the popup list.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.HeaderTemplate(System.String)

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.IgnoreAccent(System.Boolean)
member.summary: ignoreAccent set to true, then ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.IgnoreCase(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When set to false, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions. By default consider the casing.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.DropDowns.DropDownListBuilder.PopupWidth(System.String)

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.BarcodeGenerator.RenderingMode
member.summary: Defines the rendering mode of the barcode. They are SVG Canvas

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.BarcodeGenerator.BarcodeType
member.summary: Defines the type of the barcode to be generated. The barcode types are Code39 Code128 Code128A Code128B Code128C Codabar Ean8 Ean13 UpcA UpcE Code11 Code93 Code93Extension Code39Extension Code32

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.BarcodeGenerator.Alignment
member.summary: Defines the text alignment for the text to be rendered in the barcode. The text alignment types are Left Right Center

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.BarcodeGenerator.TextPosition
member.summary: Defines the text position for the text to be rendered in the barcode. The text positions are Bottom Top

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.BarcodeGenerator.ErrorCorrectionLevel
member.summary: Indicated the recovery capacity of the qrcode. The default capacity levels are Low Medium Quartile High

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.BarcodeGenerator.QRCodeVersion
member.summary: Defines the Qrcode QRCodeVersion. They are Auto Version01 Version02 Version03 Version04 Version05 Version06 Version07 Version08 Version09 Version10 Version11 Version12 Version13 Version14 Version15 Version16 Version17 Version18 Version19 Version20 Version21 Version22 Version23 Version24 Version25 Version26 Version27 Version28 Version29 Version30 Version31 Version32 Version33 Version34 Version35 Version36 Version37 Version38 Version39 Version40

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.BarcodeGenerator.DataMatrixEncoding
member.summary: Defines the encoding type for the datamatrix code. They are Auto ASCII ASCIINumeric Base256

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.BarcodeGenerator.DataMatrixSize
member.summary: Defines the size for the datamatrix code. The defined size are Auto Size10x10 Size12x12 Size14x14 Size16x16 Size18x18 Size20x20 Size22x22 Size24x24 Size26x26 Size32x32 Size36x36 Size40x40 Size44x44 Size48x48 Size52x52 Size64x64 Size72x72 Size80x80 Size88x88 Size96x96 Size104x104 Size120x120 Size132x132 Size144x144 Size8x18 Size8x32 Size12x26 Size12x36 Size16x36 Size16x48

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.FileManager.FileManagerColumn.Field
member.summary: Defines the field name of column which is mapped with mapping name of DataSource. member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.Calendar.CalendarMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the Calendar's Type like gregorian or islamic.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.Calendar.DayHeaderFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in header. By default, the format is short. Possible formats are: `Short` - Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header. `Narrow` - Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header. `Abbreviated` - Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header. `Wide` - Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.Calendar.Depth
member.summary: Sets the maximum level of view such as month, year, and decade in the Calendar. Depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.Calendar.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. value

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.Calendar.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.Calendar.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Gets or sets the Calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.Calendar.IsMultiSelection
member.summary: Specifies the option to enable the multiple dates selection of the calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.Calendar.KeyConfigs
member.summary: Customizes the key actions in Calendar. For example, when using German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.Calendar.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.Calendar.Max
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum date that can be selected in the Calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.Calendar.Min
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum date that can be selected in the Calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.Calendar.ShowTodayButton
member.summary: Specifies whether the today button is to be displayed or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.Calendar.Start
member.summary: Specifies the initial view of the Calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, initial view can be changed to year or decade view.

member.summary: Gets or sets the selected date of the Calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DatePicker.CalendarMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the Calendar's Type like gregorian or islamic.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DatePicker.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the root CSS class of the DatePicker that allows to customize the appearance by overriding the styles.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DatePicker.DayHeaderFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in header. By default, the format is short. Possible formats are: `Short` - Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header. `Narrow` - Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header. `Abbreviated` - Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header. `Wide` - Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DatePicker.Depth
member.summary: Sets the maximum level of view such as month, year, and decade in the Calendar. Depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DatePicker.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. value

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DatePicker.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DatePicker.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies the component to be disabled or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DatePicker.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Gets or sets the Calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DatePicker.FloatLabelType
member.summary: Specifies the placeholder text to be floated. Possible values are: Never: The label will never float in the input when the placeholder is available. Always: The floating label will always float above the input. Auto: The floating label will float above the input after focusing or entering a value in the input.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DatePicker.Format
member.summary: Specifies the format of the value that to be displayed in component. By default, the format is based on the culture.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DatePicker.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional html attributes such as disabled, value etc., to the element. If you configured both property and equivalent html attribute then the component considers the property value.

member.summary: Customizes the key actions in DatePicker. For example, when using German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.

member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.summary: Specifies the root CSS class of the DatePicker that allows to customize the appearance by overriding the styles.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.DayHeaderFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in header. By default, the format is short. Possible formats are: `Short` - Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header. `Narrow` - Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header. `Abbreviated` - Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header. `Wide` - Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.Depth
member.summary: Sets the maximum level of view such as month, year, and decade in the Calendar. Depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted. 1. value

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies the component to be disabled or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Gets or sets the Calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.FloatLabelType
member.summary: Specifies the placeholder text to be floated. Possible values are: Never: The label will never float in the input when the placeholder is available. Always: The floating label will always float above the input. Auto: The floating label will float above the input after focusing or entering a value in the input.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.Format
member.summary: Specifies the format of the value that to be displayed in component. By default, the format is based on the culture.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.DateTimePicker.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional html attributes such as disabled, value etc., to the element. If you configured both property and equivalent html attribute then the component considers the property value.

member.summary: Specifies the scroll bar position if there is no value is selected in the popup list or the given value is not present in the popup list. > For more details refer to [`Time Duration`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/demos/#/material/timepicker/list-formatting.html) sample.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.TimePickerBuilder.ShowClearButton(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies whether to show or hide the clear icon.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.TimePickerBuilder.Step(System.Double)
member.summary: Specifies the time interval between the two adjacent time values in the popup list. > For more details refer to [`Format`](../../timepicker/getting-started#setting-the-time-format)documentation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Calendars.TimePickerBuilder.StrictMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies the component to act as strict so that, it allows to enter only a valid time value within a specified range or else resets to previous value. By default, strictMode is in false. > For more details refer to [`Strict Mode`](../../timepicker/strict-mode/) documentation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.CssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS classes to root element of the MaskedTextBox which helps to customize the complete UI styles for the MaskedTextBox component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.CustomCharacters
member.summary:
Sets the collection of values to be mapped for non-mask elements(literals) which have been set in the mask of MaskedTextBox. In the below example, non-mask elements "P" accepts values "P" , "A" , "p" , "a" and "M" accepts values "M", "m" mentioned in the custom characters collection.
For more information on customCharacters, refer to [customCharacters](../../maskedtextbox/mask-configuration/#custom-characters).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Sets a value that enables or disables the persisting state of the MaskedTextBox after reloading the page. If enabled, the 'value' state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.Enabled
member.summary: Sets a value that enables or disables the MaskedTextBox component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.FloatLabelType
member.summary: The acts as a label and floats above the MaskedTextBox based on the below values. Possible values are: Never - The floating label will not be enable when the placeholder is available. Always - The floating label always floats above the MaskedTextBox. Auto - The floating label floats above the MaskedTextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional html attributes such as disabled, value etc., to the element. If you configured both property and equivalent html attribute then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.MaskedTextBox.Mask
member.summary: Sets a value that masks the MaskedTextBox to allow/validate the user input. Mask allows [`standard mask elements`](../../maskedtextbox/mask-configuration/#standard-mask-elements) as mask elements. For more information on mask, refer to [mask](../../maskedtextbox/mask-configuration/#standard-mask-elements). If the mask value is empty, the MaskedTextBox will behave as an input element with text type.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.NumericTextBox.FloatLabelType
member.summary: The acts as a label and floats above the NumericTextBox based on the below values. Possible values are: `Never` - Never floats the label in the NumericTextBox when the placeholder is available. `Always` - The floating label always floats above the NumericTextBox. `Auto` - The floating label floats above the NumericTextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.summary: It is used to show or hide the increase and decrease button of Slider Component, which is used to change the slider value. Refer the documentation [here](../../slider/getting-started#buttons) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Slider.Step
member.summary: It is used to denote the step value of Slider component which is the amount of Slider value change when increase / decrease button is clicked or press arrow keys or drag the thumb. Refer the documentation [here](../../slider/ticks#step) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Slider.Ticks
member.summary: It is used to render the slider ticks options such as placement and step values. Refer the documentation [here](../../slider/ticks) to know more about this property with demo.

member.summary: It is used to denote the slider tooltip and it's position.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Slider.Type
member.summary: It is used to denote the type of the Slider. The available options are: default - Used to select a single value in the Slider. minRange - Used to select a single value in the Slider. It displays shadow from the start value to the current value. range - Used to select a range of values in the Slider. It displays shadow in-between the selection range.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Slider.Value
member.summary: It is used to denote the current value of the Slider. The value should be specified in array of number when render Slider type as range.

member.summary: We can trigger change event whenever Slider value is changed. In other term, this event will be triggered while drag the slider thumb.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.SliderTooltipDataBuilder.ShowOn(Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TooltipShowOn)
member.summary: It is used to determine the device mode to show the Tooltip. If it is in desktop, it will show the Tooltip content when hovering on the target element. If it is in touch device. It will show the Tooltip content when tap and holding on the target element.

member.summary: It is used to denote the distance between two major (large) ticks from the scale of the Slider.

member.summary: It is used to denote the position of the ticks in the Slider. The available options are:

member.summary: We can show or hide the small ticks in the Slider, which will be appeared in between the largeTicks.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.SliderTicksData.SmallStep

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.Autocomplete
member.summary: Specifies whether the browser is allow to automatically enter or select a value for the textbox. By default, autocomplete is enabled for textbox. Possible values are: `on` - Specifies that autocomplete is enabled. `off` - Specifies that autocomplete is disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class value that is appended to wrapper of Textbox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting TextBox state between page reloads. If enabled, the `value` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether the TextBox allow user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.FloatLabelType
member.summary: Specifies the floating label behavior of the TextBox that the placeholder text floats above the TextBox based on the below values. Possible values are: `Never` - The placeholder text should not be float ever. `Always` - The placeholder text floats above the TextBox always. `Auto` - The placeholder text floats above the TextBox while focusing or enter a value in Textbox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional html attributes such as disabled, value etc., to the element. If you configured both property and equivalent html attribute then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.Multiline
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that enable or disable the multiline on the TextBox. The TextBox changes from single line to multiline when enable this multiline mode.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.Placeholder
member.summary: Specifies the text that is shown as a hint/placeholder until the user focus or enter a value in Textbox. The property is depending on the floatLabelType property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.Readonly
member.summary: Specifies the boolean value whether the TextBox allows user to change the text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.ShowClearButton
member.summary: Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether the clear button is displayed in Textbox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.Type
member.summary: Specifies the behavior of the TextBox such as text, password, email, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.Value
member.summary: Sets the content of the TextBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.Blur
member.summary: Triggers when the TextBox has focus-out.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.Change
member.summary: Triggers when the content of TextBox has changed and gets focus-out.

member.summary: Triggers when the TextBox component is created.

member.summary: Triggers when the TextBox component is destroyed.

member.summary: Triggers when the TextBox gets focus.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.TextBox.Input
member.summary: Triggers each time when the value of TextBox has changed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.ChunkSize
member.summary: Specifies the chunk size to split the large file into chunks, and upload it to the server in a sequential order. If the chunk size property has value, the uploader enables the chunk upload by default. It must be specified in bytes value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RemoveUrl
member.summary: Specifies the URL of remove action that receives the file information and handle the remove operation in server. The remove action type must be POST request and define removeFileNames attribute to get file information that will be removed. This property is optional.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RetryAfterDelay
member.summary: Specifies the delay time in milliseconds that the automatic retry happens after the delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RetryCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of retries that the uploader can perform on the file failed to upload. By default, the uploader set 3 as maximum retries. This property must be specified to prevent infinity looping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.SaveUrl
member.summary: Specifies the URL of save action that will receive the upload files and save in the server. The save action type must be POST request and define the argument as same input name used to render the component. The upload operations could not perform without this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderButtonsProps.Browse
member.summary: Specifies the text or html content to browse button

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderButtonsProps.Clear
member.summary: Specifies the text or html content to clear button

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderButtonsProps.Upload
member.summary: Specifies the text or html content to upload button

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderButtonsProps.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderUploadedFiles.Name
member.summary: Specifies the name of the file

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderUploadedFiles.Size
member.summary: Specifies the size of the file

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.UploaderUploadedFiles.Type
member.summary: Specifies the type of the file

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.AllowedExtensions
member.summary: Specifies the extensions of the file types allowed in the uploader component and pass the extensions with comma separators. For example, if you want to upload specific image files, pass allowedExtensions as .jpg,.png.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.AsyncSettings
member.summary: Configures the save and remove URL to perform the upload operations in the server asynchronously.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.AutoUpload
member.summary: By default, the uploader component initiates automatic upload when the files are added in upload queue. If you want to manipulate the files before uploading to server, disable the autoUpload property. The buttons upload and clear will be hided from file list when autoUpload property is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Buttons
member.summary: You can customize the default text of browse, clear, and upload buttons with plain text or HTML elements. The buttons text can be customized from localization also. If you configured both locale and buttons property, the uploader component considers the buttons property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with root element of the uploader. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a uploader.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.DirectoryUpload
member.summary: Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether the folder of files can be browsed in the uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.DropArea
member.summary: Specifies the drop target to handle the drag-and-drop upload. By default, the component creates wrapper around file input that will act as drop target.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies Boolean value that indicates whether the component is enabled or disabled. The uploader component does not allow to interact when this property is disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Files
member.summary: Specifies the list of files that will be preloaded on rendering of uploader component. The property used to view and remove the uploaded files from server. By default, the files are configured with uploaded successfully state. The following properties are mandatory to configure the preload files: Name Size Type

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional html attributes such as disabled, value etc., to the element. If you configured both property and equivalent html attribute then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.MaxFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum allowed file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload too large files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.MinFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the minimum file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload empty files and small files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Multiple
member.summary: Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether the multiple files can be browsed or dropped simultaneously in the uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.SequentialUpload
member.summary: By default, the file uploader component is processing the multiple files simultaneously. If sequentialUpload property is enabled, the file upload component performs the upload one after the other.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.ShowFileList
member.summary: Specifies a Boolean value that indicates whether the default file list can be rendered. The property used to prevent default file list and design own template for file list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Template
member.summary: Specifies the HTML string that used to customize the content of each file in the list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.ActionComplete
member.summary: Triggers after all the selected files has processed to upload successfully or failed to server.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.BeforeRemove
member.summary: Triggers on remove the uploaded file. The event used to get confirm before remove the file from server.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.BeforeUpload
member.summary: Triggers when the upload process before. This event is used to add additional parameter with upload request.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Canceling
member.summary: Fires if cancel the chunk file uploading.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Change
member.summary: Triggers when changes occur in uploaded file list by selecting or dropping files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.ChunkFailure
member.summary: Fires if the chunk file failed to upload.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.ChunkSuccess
member.summary: Fires when the chunk file uploaded successfully.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.ChunkUploading
member.summary: Fires when every chunk upload process gets started. This event is used to add additional parameter with upload request.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Clearing
member.summary: Triggers before clearing the items in file list when clicking clear.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Created
member.summary: Triggers when the component is created.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Failure
member.summary: Triggers when the AJAX request fails on uploading or removing files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.FileListRendering
member.summary: Triggers before rendering each file item from the file list in a page. It helps to customize specific file item structure.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Pausing
member.summary: Fires if pause the chunk file uploading.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Progress
member.summary: Triggers when uploading a file to the server using the AJAX request.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Removing
member.summary: Triggers on removing the uploaded file. The event used to get confirm before removing the file from server.

member.summary: DEPRECATED-Triggers before rendering each file item from the file list in a page. It helps to customize specific file item structure.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Resuming
member.summary: Fires if resume the paused chunk file upload.

member.summary: Triggers after selecting or dropping the files by adding the files in upload queue.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Inputs.Uploader.Success
member.summary: Triggers when the AJAX request gets success on uploading files or removing files.

member.summary: Triggers when the upload process gets started. This event is used to add additional parameter with upload request.

member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Layouts.Splitter.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.summary: Specifies the height of the Splitter component that accepts both string and number values.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Layouts.Splitter.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Layouts.Splitter.Orientation
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether to align the split panes horizontally or vertically. Set the orientation property as "Horizontal" to create a horizontal splitter that aligns the panes left-to-right. Set the orientation property as "Vertical" to create a vertical splitter that aligns the panes top-to-bottom.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Layouts.Splitter.PaneSettings
member.summary: Configures the individual pane behaviors such as content, size, resizable, minimum, maximum validation, collapsible and collapsed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Layouts.Splitter.SeparatorSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of the separator line for both horizontal or vertical orientation. The separator is used to separate the panes by lines.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Layouts.Splitter.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Splitter control, which accepts both string and number values as width. The string value can be either in pixel or percentage format.

member.summary: Defines the constraints of connector None - Interaction of the connectors cannot be done. Select - Selects the connector. Delete - Delete the connector. Drag - Drag the connector. DragSourceEnd - Drag the source end of the connector. DragTargetEnd - Drag the target end of the connector. DragSegmentThump - Drag the segment thumb of the connector. AllowDrop - Allow to drop a node. Bridging - Creates bridge on intersection of two connectors. InheritBridging - Creates bridge on intersection of two connectors. PointerEvents - Sets the pointer events. Tooltip - Displays a tooltip for the connectors. InheritToolTip - Displays a tooltip for the connectors. Interaction - Features of the connector used for interaction. ReadOnly - Enables ReadOnly

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.Diagram.Constraints
member.summary: Constraints are used to enable/disable certain behaviors of the diagram. None - Disables DiagramConstraints constraints Bridging - Enables/Disables Bridging support for connector UndoRedo - Enables/Disables the Undo/Redo support Tooltip - Enables/Disables Tooltip support UserInteraction - Enables/Disables editing diagram interactively ApiUpdate - Enables/Disables editing diagram through code PageEditable - Enables/Disables editing diagrams both interactively and through code Zoom - Enables/Disables Zoom support for the diagram PanX - Enables/Disable PanX support for the diagram PanY - Enables/Disable PanY support for the diagram Pan - Enables/Disable Pan support the diagram

DragSourceEnd - Drag the source end of the connector. DragTargetEnd - Drag the target end of the connector. DragSegmentThump - Drag the segment thumb of the connector. AllowDrop - Allow to drop a node. Bridging - Creates bridge on intersection of two connectors. InheritBridging - Creates bridge on intersection of two connectors. PointerEvents - Sets the pointer events. Tooltip - Displays a tooltip for the connectors. InheritToolTip - Displays a tooltip for the connectors. Interaction - Features of the connector used for interaction. ReadOnly - Enables ReadOnly

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.DiagramSnapSettingsBuilder.Constraints(Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.SnapConstraints)
member.summary: Constraints for gridlines and snapping None - Snapping does not happen ShowHorizontalLines - Displays only the horizontal gridlines in diagram. ShowVerticalLines - Displays only the Vertical gridlines in diagram. ShowLines - Display both Horizontal and Vertical gridlines. SnapToHorizontalLines - Enables the object to snap only with horizontal gridlines. SnapToVerticalLines - Enables the object to snap only with horizontal gridlines. SnapToLines - Enables the object to snap with both horizontal and Vertical gridlines. snapToObject - Enables the object to snap with the other objects in the diagram.
