member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.DiagramTextStyleBuilder.TextAlign(Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.TextAlign)
member.summary: Defines how the text should be aligned within its bounds Left - Aligns the text at the left of the text bounds Right - Aligns the text at the right of the text bounds Center - Aligns the text at the center of the text bounds Justify - Aligns the text in a justified manner

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.DiagramTextStyleBuilder.TextDecoration(Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.TextDecoration)
member.summary: Defines how the text should be decorated. For example, with underline/over line Overline - Decorates the text with a line above the text Underline - Decorates the text with an underline LineThrough - Decorates the text by striking it with a line None - Text will not have any specific decoration

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.DiagramTextStyleBuilder.TextOverflow(Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.TextOverflow)
member.summary: Defines how to handle the text when it exceeds the given size. Wrap - Wraps the text to next line, when it exceeds its bounds Ellipsis - It truncates the overflown text and represents the clipping with an ellipsis Clip - It clips the overflow text

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.DiagramTextStyleBuilder.TextWrapping(Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.TextWrap)
member.summary: Defines how the text should be wrapped, when the text size exceeds some specific bounds WrapWithOverflow - Wraps the text so that no word is broken Wrap - Wraps the text and breaks the word, if necessary NoWrap - Text will no be wrapped

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.DiagramTextStyleBuilder.WhiteSpace(Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.WhiteSpace)
member.summary: Defines how the white space and new line characters have to be handled PreserveAll - Preserves all empty spaces and empty lines CollapseSpace - Collapses the consequent spaces into one CollapseAll - Collapses all consequent empty spaces and empty lines

member.summary: Defines the type of the flow shape Process - Sets the type of the flow shape as Process Decision - Sets the type of the flow shape as Decision Document - Sets the type of the flow shape as Document PreDefinedProcess - Sets the type of the flow shape as PreDefinedProcess Terminator - Sets the type of the flow shape as Terminator PaperTap - Sets the type of the flow shape as PaperTap DirectData - Sets the type of the flow shape as DirectData SequentialData - Sets the type of the flow shape as SequentialData MultiData - Sets the type of the flow shape as MultiData Collate - Sets the type of the flow shape as Collate SummingJunction - Sets the type of the flow shape as SummingJunction Or - Sets the type of the flow shape as Or InternalStorage - Sets the type of the flow shape as InternalStorage Extract - Sets the type of the flow shape as Extract ManualOperation - Sets the type of the flow shape as ManualOperation Merge - Sets the type of the flow shape as Merge OffPageReference - Sets the type of the flow shape as OffPageReference SequentialAccessStorage - Sets the type of the flow shape as SequentialAccessStorage Annotation - Sets the type of the flow shape as Annotation Annotation2 - Sets the type of the flow shape as Annotation2 Data - Sets the type of the flow shape as Data Card - Sets the type of the flow shape as Card Delay - Sets the type of the flow shape as Delay Preparation - Sets the type of the flow shape as Preparation Display - Sets the type of the flow shape as Display ManualInput - Sets the type of the flow shape as ManualInput LoopLimit - Sets the type of the flow shape as LoopLimit StoredData - Sets the type of the flow shape as StoredData

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.DiagramSnapSettings.Constraints
member.summary: Constraints for gridlines and snapping None - Snapping does not happen ShowHorizontalLines - Displays only the horizontal gridlines in diagram. ShowVerticalLines - Displays only the Vertical gridlines in diagram. ShowLines - Display both Horizontal and Vertical gridlines. SnapToHorizontalLines - Enables the object to snap only with horizontal gridlines. SnapToVerticalLines - Enables the object to snap only with horizontal gridlines. SnapToLines - Enables the object to snap with both horizontal and Vertical gridlines. snapToObject - Enables the object to snap with the other objects in the diagram.

member.summary: Defines how the text should be aligned within its bounds Left - Aligns the text at the left of the text bounds Right - Aligns the text at the right of the text bounds Center - Aligns the text at the center of the text bounds Justify - Aligns the text in a justified manner

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.DiagramTextStyle.TextDecoration
member.summary: Defines how the text should be decorated. For example, with underline/over line Overline - Decorates the text with a line above the text Underline - Decorates the text with an underline LineThrough - Decorates the text by striking it with a line None - Text will not have any specific decoration

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.DiagramTextStyle.TextOverflow
member.summary: Defines how to handle the text when it exceeds the given size. Wrap - Wraps the text to next line, when it exceeds its bounds Ellipsis - It truncates the overflown text and represents the clipping with an ellipsis Clip - It clips the overflow text

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.DiagramTextStyle.TextWrapping
member.summary: Defines how the text should be wrapped, when the text size exceeds some specific bounds WrapWithOverflow - Wraps the text so that no word is broken Wrap - Wraps the text and breaks the word, if necessary NoWrap - Text will no be wrapped

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.DiagramTextStyle.WhiteSpace
member.summary: Defines how the white space and new line characters have to be handled PreserveAll - Preserves all empty spaces and empty lines CollapseSpace - Collapses the consequent spaces into one CollapseAll - Collapses all consequent empty spaces and empty lines

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.DiagramConstraints
member.summary: Enables/Disables certain features of diagram None - Disable DiagramConstraints constraints Bridging - Enables/Disable Bridging support for connector UndoRedo - Enables/Disable the Undo/Redo support Tooltip - Enables/Disable Tooltip support UserInteraction - Enables/Disable UserInteraction support for the diagram ApiUpdate - Enables/Disable ApiUpdate support for the diagram PageEditable - Enables/Disable PageEditable support for the diagram Zoom - Enables/Disable Zoom support for the diagram PanX - Enables/Disable PanX support for the diagram PanY - Enables/Disable PanY support for the diagram Pan - Enables/Disable Pan support the diagram ZoomTextEdit - Enables/Disables zooming the text box while editing the text Virtualization - Enables/Disable Virtualization support the diagram Default - Enables/Disable all constraints

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.RenderingMode
member.summary: Defines the rendering mode of the diagram SVG - Renders the diagram objects as SVG elements Canvas - Renders the diagram in a canvas

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.DiagramTools
member.summary: Activates the diagram tools None - Enables/Disable single select support for the diagram SingleSelect - Enables/Disable single select support for the diagram MultipleSelect - Enables/Disable MultipleSelect select support for the diagram ZoomPan - Enables/Disable ZoomPan support for the diagram DrawOnce - Enables/Disable continuousDraw support for the diagram ContinuousDraw - Enables/Disable continuousDraw support for the diagram Default - Enables/Disable all constraints

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.ConnectorConstraints
member.summary: Defines the constraints to enable/disable certain features of connector. None - Interaction of the connectors cannot be done. Select - Selects the connector. Delete - Delete the connector. Drag - Drag the connector. DragSourceEnd - Drag the source end of the connector. DragTargetEnd - Drag the target end of the connector. DragSegmentThump - Drag the segment thumb of the connector. AllowDrop - Allow to drop a node. Bridging - Creates bridge on intersection of two connectors. BridgeObstacle - InheritBridging - Creates bridge on intersection of two connectors. PointerEvents - Sets the pointer events. Tooltip - Displays a tooltip for the connectors. InheritToolTip - Displays a tooltip for the connectors. Interaction - Features of the connector used for interaction. ReadOnly - Enables ReadOnly Default - Default features of the connector.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.FlipDirection
member.summary: Defines how the diagram elements have to be flipped with respect to its immediate parent FlipHorizontal - Translate the diagram element throughout its immediate parent FlipVertical - Rotate the diagram element throughout its immediate parent Both - Rotate and Translate the diagram element throughout its immediate parent None - Set the flip Direction as None

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.Segments

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.AnnotationAlignment

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.AnnotationConstraints

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.TextDecoration
member.summary: Defines how to decorate the text Overline - Decorates the text with a line above the text Underline - Decorates the text with an underline LineThrough - Decorates the text by striking it with a line None - Text will not have any specific decoration

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.TextAlign
member.summary: Defines how the text has to be aligned Left - Aligns the text at the left of the text bounds Right - Aligns the text at the right of the text bounds Center - Aligns the text at the center of the text bounds Justify - Aligns the text in a justified manner

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.TextOverflow
member.summary: Defines how to handle the text when it exceeds the element bounds Wrap - Wraps the text to next line, when it exceeds its bounds Ellipsis - It truncates the overflown text and represents the clipping with an ellipsis Clip - It clips the overflow text

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.TextWrap
member.summary: Defines how to wrap the text when it exceeds the element bounds WrapWithOverflow - Wraps the text so that no word is broken Wrap - Wraps the text and breaks the word, if necessary NoWrap - Text will no be wrapped

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.WhiteSpace
member.summary: Defines how to handle the empty space and empty lines of a text PreserveAll - Preserves all empty spaces and empty lines CollapseSpace - Collapses the consequent spaces into one CollapseAll - Collapses all consequent empty spaces and empty lines

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.ClassifierShape
member.summary: Enables/Disables shape of the uml classifier shapes Package - Indicates the scope is public. Class - Indicates the scope is protected. Interface - Indicates the scope is private. Enumeration - Indicates the scope is package. CollapsedPackage - Indicates the scope is public. Inheritance - Indicates the scope is protected. Association - Indicates the scope is private. Aggregation - Indicates the scope is package. Composition - Indicates the scope is public. Realization - Indicates the scope is protected. DirectedAssociation - Indicates the scope is private. Dependency - Indicates the scope is package.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.SnapConstraints
member.summary: Defines the constraints to Enables / Disables some features of Snapping. None - Snapping does not happen ShowHorizontalLines - Displays only the horizontal gridlines in diagram. ShowVerticalLines - Displays only the Vertical gridlines in diagram. ShowLines - Display both Horizontal and Vertical gridlines. SnapToHorizontalLines - Enables the object to snap only with horizontal gridlines. SnapToVerticalLines - Enables the object to snap only with horizontal gridlines. SnapToLines - Enables the object to snap with both horizontal and Vertical gridlines. snapToObject - Enables the object to snap with the other objects in the diagram.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.RulerOrientation
member.summary: Set of orientations available for Ruler.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.TickAlignment
member.summary: Set of TickAlignment available for Ruler.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.BoundaryConstraints
member.summary: Defines the BoundaryConstraints for the diagram Infinity - Allow the interactions to take place at the infinite height and width Diagram - Allow the interactions to take place around the diagram height and width Page - Allow the interactions to take place around the page height and width

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.PageOrientation
member.summary: Defines the orientation of the Page Landscape - Display with page Width is more than the page Height. Portrait - Display with page Height is more than the page width.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.SelectorConstraints
member.summary: Defines the visibility of the selector handles None - Hides all the selector elements ConnectorSourceThumb - Shows/hides the source thumb of the connector ConnectorTargetThumb - Shows/hides the target thumb of the connector ResizeSouthEast - Shows/hides the bottom right resize handle of the selector ResizeSouthWest - Shows/hides the bottom left resize handle of the selector ResizeNorthEast - Shows/hides the top right resize handle of the selector ResizeNorthWest - Shows/hides the top left resize handle of the selector ResizeEast - Shows/hides the middle right resize handle of the selector ResizeWest - Shows/hides the middle left resize handle of the selector ResizeSouth - Shows/hides the bottom center resize handle of the selector ResizeNorth - Shows/hides the top center resize handle of the selector Rotate - Shows/hides the rotate handle of the selector UserHandles - Shows/hides the user handles of the selector Resize - Shows/hides all resize handles of the selector

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.RubberBandSelectionMode
member.summary: Defines how to handle the rubber band selection CompleteIntersect - Selects the objects that are contained within the selected region PartialIntersect - Selects the objects that are partially intersected with the selected region

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.Side
member.summary: Defines where the user handles have to be aligned Top - Aligns the user handles at the top of an object Bottom - Aligns the user handles at the bottom of an object Left - Aligns the user handles at the left of an object Right - Aligns the user handles at the right of an object

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.ConnectionDirection
member.summary: Defines how the first segments have to be defined in a layout Auto - Defines the first segment direction based on the type of the layout Orientation - Defines the first segment direction based on the orientation of the layout Custom - Defines the first segment direction dynamically by the user

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.ConnectorSegments
member.summary: Defines how the connectors have to be routed in a layout Default - Routes the connectors like a default diagram Layout - Routes the connectors based on the type of the layout

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.LayoutOrientation
member.summary: Defines the orientation of the layout TopToBottom - Renders the layout from top to bottom BottomToTop - Renders the layout from bottom to top LeftToRight - Renders the layout from left to right RightToLeft - Renders the layout from right to left

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Diagrams.LayoutType
member.summary: Defines the types of the automatic layout None - None of the layouts is applied HierarchicalTree - Defines the type of the layout as Hierarchical Tree OrganizationalChart - Defines the type of the layout as Organizational Chart ComplexHierarchicalTree - Defines the type of the layout as complex HierarchicalTree RadialTree - Defines the type of the layout as Radial tree

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Delay
member.summary: Specifies the delay in milliseconds to start animation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Duration
member.summary: Specifies the duration in milliseconds that the animation takes to open or close the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Effect
member.summary: Specifies the animation name that should be applied on open and close the dialog. If user sets Fade animation, the dialog will open with `FadeIn` effect and close with `FadeOut` effect. The following are the list of animation effects available to configure to the dialog: 1. Fade 2. FadeZoom 3. FlipLeftDown 4. FlipLeftUp 5. FlipRightDown 6. FlipRightUp 7. FlipXDown 8. FlipXUp 9. FlipYLeft 10. FlipYRight 11. SlideBottom 12. SlideLeft 13. SlideRight 14. SlideTop 15. Zoom 16. None

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogDialogButton.ButtonModel
member.summary: Specifies the button component properties to render the dialog buttons.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogDialogButton.Type
member.summary: Specify the type of the button. Possible values are Button, Submit and Reset.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogDialogButton.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.AllowDragging
member.summary: Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be dragged by the end-user. The dialog allows to drag by selecting the header and dragging it for re-position the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.AnimationSettings
member.summary: Specifies the animation settings of the dialog component. The animation effect can be applied on open and close the dialog with duration and delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Buttons
member.summary: Configures the action `buttons` that contains button properties with primary attributes and click events. One or more action buttons can be configured to the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.CloseOnEscape
member.summary: Specifies the boolean value whether the dialog can be closed with the escape key that is used to control the dialog's closing behavior.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Content
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in dialog's content area. It can be information, list, or other HTML elements. The content of dialog can be loaded with dynamic data such as database, AJAX content, and more.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with root element of the dialog. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.EnableResize
member.summary: Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be resized by the end-user. If enableResize is true, the dialog component creates grip to resize it diagonal direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Specifies the template value that can be displayed with dialog's footer area. This is optional property and can be used only when the footer is occupied with information or custom components. By default, the footer is configured with action [buttons](#buttons). If footer template is configured to dialog, the action buttons property will be disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Header
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in the dialog's title area that can be configured with plain text or HTML elements. This is optional property and the dialog can be displayed without header, if the header property is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the dialog component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.IsModal
member.summary: Specifies the Boolean value whether the dialog can be displayed as modal or non-modal. `Modal`: It creates overlay that disable interaction with the parent application and user should respond with modal before continuing with other applications. `Modeless`: It does not prevent user interaction with parent application.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Position
member.summary: Specifies the value where the dialog can be positioned within the document or target. The position can be represented with pre-configured positions or specific X and Y values. `X value`: left, center, right, or offset value. `Y value`: top, center, bottom, or offset value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.ShowCloseIcon
member.summary: Specifies the value that represents whether the close icon is shown in the dialog component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Target
member.summary: Specifies the target element in which to display the dialog. The default value is null, which refers the `document.body` element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Visible
member.summary: Specifies the value that represents whether the dialog component is visible.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.ZIndex
member.summary: Specifies the z-order for rendering that determines whether the dialog is displayed in front or behind of another component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Dialog.BeforeClose
member.summary: Event triggers before the dialog is closed. If you cancel this event, the dialog remains opened. Set the cancel argument to true to cancel the closure of a dialog.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogAnimationSettingsBuilder.Delay(System.Double)
member.summary: Specifies the delay in milliseconds to start animation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogAnimationSettingsBuilder.Duration(System.Double)
member.summary: Specifies the duration in milliseconds that the animation takes to open or close the dialog.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogAnimationSettingsBuilder.Effect(Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogEffect)
member.summary: Specifies the animation name that should be applied on open and close the dialog. If user sets Fade animation, the dialog will open with `FadeIn` effect and close with `FadeOut` effect. The following are the list of animation effects available to configure to the dialog: 1. Fade 2. FadeZoom 3. FlipLeftDown 4. FlipLeftUp 5. FlipRightDown 6. FlipRightUp 7. FlipXDown 8. FlipXUp 9. FlipYLeft 10. FlipYRight 11. SlideBottom 12. SlideLeft 13. SlideRight 14. SlideTop 15. Zoom 16. None

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.HtmlAttributes(System.Object)
member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.AllowDragging(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be dragged by the end-user. The dialog allows to drag by selecting the header and dragging it for re-position the dialog.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.AnimationSettings(Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings)
member.summary: Specifies the animation settings of the dialog component. The animation effect can be applied on open and close the dialog with duration and delay.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.Buttons(System.Collections.Generic.List{Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogDialogButton})
member.summary: Configures the action `buttons` that contains button properties with primary attributes and click events. One or more action buttons can be configured to the dialog.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.CloseOnEscape(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies the boolean value whether the dialog can be closed with the escape key that is used to control the dialog's closing behavior.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.Content(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in dialog's content area. It can be information, list, or other HTML elements. The content of dialog can be loaded with dynamic data such as database, AJAX content, and more.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.CssClass(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with root element of the dialog. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a dialog.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.EnablePersistence(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.EnableResize(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be resized by the end-user. If enableResize is true, the dialog component creates grip to resize it diagonal direction.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.EnableRtl(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.FooterTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the template value that can be displayed with dialog's footer area. This is optional property and can be used only when the footer is occupied with information or custom components. By default, the footer is configured with action [buttons](#buttons). If footer template is configured to dialog, the action buttons property will be disabled.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.Header(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in the dialog's title area that can be configured with plain text or HTML elements. This is optional property and the dialog can be displayed without header, if the header property is null.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.Height(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the height of the dialog component.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.Height(System.Double)
member.summary: Specifies the height of the dialog component.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.IsModal(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies the Boolean value whether the dialog can be displayed as modal or non-modal. `Modal`: It creates overlay that disable interaction with the parent application and user should respond with modal before continuing with other applications. `Modeless`: It does not prevent user interaction with parent application.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.Locale(System.String)
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.Position(Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogPositionData)
member.summary: Specifies the value where the dialog can be positioned within the document or target. The position can be represented with pre-configured positions or specific X and Y values. `X value`: left, center, right, or offset value. `Y value`: top, center, bottom, or offset value.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.ShowCloseIcon(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies the value that represents whether the close icon is shown in the dialog component.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.DialogBuilder.Target(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies the target element in which to display the dialog. The default value is null, which refers the `document.body` element.

member.summary: Specifies the value that represents whether the dialog component is visible.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Popup.ActionOnScroll
member.summary: specifies the action that should happen when scroll the target-parent container. This property should define either `reposition` or `hide`. when set `reposition` to this property, the popup position will refresh when scroll any parent container. when set `hide` to this property, the popup will be closed when scroll any parent container.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.Animation
member.summary: We can set the same or different animation option to Tooltip while it is in open or close state. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/animation.html?lang=typescript) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.CloseDelay
member.summary: It is used to close the Tooltip after a specified delay in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.Content
member.summary: It is used to display the content of Tooltip which can be both string and HTML Elements. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/content.html?lang=typescript) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.CssClass
member.summary: It is used to customize the Tooltip which accepts custom CSS class names that defines specific user-defined styles and themes to be applied on the Tooltip element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.Height
member.summary: It is used to set the height of Tooltip component which accepts both string and number values. When Tooltip content gets overflow due to height value then the scroll mode will be enabled. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/setting-dimension.html?lang=typescript) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.IsSticky
member.summary: It is used to display the Tooltip in an open state until closed by manually. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/open-mode.html?lang=typescript#sticky-mode) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.MouseTrail
member.summary: It allows the Tooltip to follow the mouse pointer movement over the specified target element. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/position.html?lang=typescript#mouse-trailing) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.OffsetX
member.summary: It sets the space between the target and Tooltip element in X axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.OffsetY
member.summary: It sets the space between the target and Tooltip element in Y axis.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.OpenDelay
member.summary: It is used to open the Tooltip after the specified delay in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.OpensOn
member.summary: It is used to determine the device mode to display the Tooltip content. If it is in desktop, it will show the Tooltip content when hovering on the target element. If it is in touch device, it will show the Tooltip content when tap and holding on the target element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.Position
member.summary: It is used to set the position of Tooltip element, with respect to Target element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.ShowTipPointer
member.summary: It is used to show or hide the tip pointer of Tooltip.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.Target
member.summary: It is used to denote the target selector where the Tooltip need to be displayed. The target element is considered as parent container.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.TipPointerPosition
member.summary: It is used to set the position of tip pointer on tooltip. When it sets to auto, the tip pointer auto adjusts within the space of target's length and does not point outside. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/position.html?lang=typescript#tip-pointer-positioning) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.Width
member.summary: It is used to set the width of Tooltip component which accepts both string and number values. When set to auto, the Tooltip width gets auto adjusted to display its content within the viewable screen.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.AfterClose
member.summary: We can trigger `afterClose` event when the Tooltip Component gets closed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.AfterOpen
member.summary: We can trigger `afterOpen` event after the Tooltip Component gets opened.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.BeforeClose
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeClose` event before the Tooltip hides from the screen. If returned false, then the Tooltip is no more hidden.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.BeforeCollision
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeCollision` event for every collision fit calculation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.BeforeOpen
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeOpen` event before the Tooltip is displayed over the target element. When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip display can be prevented. This event is mainly used for the purpose of refreshing the Tooltip positions dynamically or to set customized styles in it and so on.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.BeforeRender
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeRender` event before the Tooltip and its contents are added to the DOM. When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip can be prevented from rendering on the page. This event is mainly used for the purpose of customizing the Tooltip before it shows up on the screen. For example, to load the AJAX content or to set new animation effects on the Tooltip, this event can be opted. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/content.html?lang=typescript#dynamic-content-via-ajax) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.Created
member.summary: We can trigger `created` event after the Tooltip component is created.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Tooltip.Destroyed
member.summary: We can trigger `destroyed` event when the Tooltip component is destroyed.

member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.OffsetY(System.Double)
member.summary: It sets the space between the target and Tooltip element in Y axis.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.OpenDelay(System.Double)
member.summary: It is used to open the Tooltip after the specified delay in milliseconds.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.OpensOn(System.String)
member.summary: It is used to determine the device mode to display the Tooltip content. If it is in desktop, it will show the Tooltip content when hovering on the target element. If it is in touch device, it will show the Tooltip content when tap and holding on the target element.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.Position(Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.Position)
member.summary: It is used to set the position of Tooltip element, with respect to Target element.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.ShowTipPointer(System.Boolean)
member.summary: It is used to show or hide the tip pointer of Tooltip.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.Target(System.String)
member.summary: It is used to denote the target selector where the Tooltip need to be displayed. The target element is considered as parent container.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.TipPointerPosition(Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TipPointerPosition)
member.summary: It is used to set the position of tip pointer on tooltip. When it sets to auto, the tip pointer auto adjusts within the space of target's length and does not point outside. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/position.html?lang=typescript#tip-pointer-positioning) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.Width(System.String)
member.summary: It is used to set the width of Tooltip component which accepts both string and number values. When set to auto, the Tooltip width gets auto adjusted to display its content within the viewable screen.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.Width(System.Double)
member.summary: It is used to set the width of Tooltip component which accepts both string and number values. When set to auto, the Tooltip width gets auto adjusted to display its content within the viewable screen.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.AfterClose(System.String)
member.summary: We can trigger `afterClose` event when the Tooltip Component gets closed.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.AfterOpen(System.String)
member.summary: We can trigger `afterOpen` event after the Tooltip Component gets opened.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.BeforeClose(System.String)
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeClose` event before the Tooltip hides from the screen. If returned false, then the Tooltip is no more hidden.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.BeforeCollision(System.String)
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeCollision` event for every collision fit calculation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.BeforeOpen(System.String)
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeOpen` event before the Tooltip is displayed over the target element. When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip display can be prevented. This event is mainly used for the purpose of refreshing the Tooltip positions dynamically or to set customized styles in it and so on.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.BeforeRender(System.String)
member.summary: We can trigger `beforeRender` event before the Tooltip and its contents are added to the DOM. When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip can be prevented from rendering on the page. This event is mainly used for the purpose of customizing the Tooltip before it shows up on the screen. For example, to load the AJAX content or to set new animation effects on the Tooltip, this event can be opted. Refer the documentation [here](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/tooltip/content.html?lang=typescript#dynamic-content-via-ajax) to know more about this property with demo.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.Created(System.String)
member.summary: We can trigger `created` event after the Tooltip component is created.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Popups.TooltipBuilder.Destroyed(System.String)
member.summary: We can trigger `destroyed` event when the Tooltip component is destroyed.

member.summary: Defines tab container type in add or edit dialog

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.TimelineViewMode
member.summary: Defines the schedule header mode. They are none - Define the default mode header. week - Define the week mode header. day - Define the day mode header. hours - Define the hours mode header. minute - Define the minutes mode header.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.SortDirection
member.summary: Defines directions of Sorting. They are Ascending Descending

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.EditMode
member.summary: Defines modes of editing. Auto Dialog

member.summary: To define new position for add action

member.summary: To define hierarchy mode on filter action

member.summary: To define initial view of Gantt

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.SearchHierarchyMode
member.summary: To define hierarchy mode on search action

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttAddDialogField.Fields
member.summary: Defines edited column fields placed inside the tab.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttAddDialogField.HeaderText
member.summary: Defines header text of tab item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttAddDialogField.Type
member.summary: Defines types of tab which contains editor for columns. `General` - Defines tab container type as general. `Dependency` - Defines tab as dependency editor. `Resources` - Defines tab as resources editor. `Notes` - Defines tab as notes editor. `Custom` - Defines tab as custom column editor.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttColumn.AllowEditing
member.summary: If `allowEditing` set to false, then it disables editing of a particular column. By default all columns are editable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttColumn.AllowFiltering
member.summary: If `allowFiltering` set to false, then it disables filtering option and filter bar element of a particular column. By default all columns are filterable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttColumn.AllowReordering
member.summary: If `allowReordering` set to false, then it disables reorder of a particular column. By default all columns can be reorder.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttColumn.AllowResizing
member.summary: If `allowResizing` is set to false, it disables resize option of a particular column. By default all the columns can be resized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttColumn.AllowSorting
member.summary: If `allowSorting` set to false, then it disables sorting option of a particular column. By default all columns are sortable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttColumn.ClipMode
member.summary: Defines the cell content's overflow mode. The available modes are `Clip` - Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area. `Ellipsis` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area. `EllipsisWithTooltip` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area also it will display tooltip while hover on ellipsis applied cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttColumn.CustomAttributes
member.summary: The CSS styles and attributes of the content cells of a particular column can be customized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttColumn.DisableHtmlEncode
member.summary: If `disableHtmlEncode` is set to true, it encodes the HTML of the header and content cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttColumn.DisplayAsCheckBox
member.summary: If `displayAsCheckBox` is set to true, it displays the column value as a check box instead of Boolean value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttColumn.Edit
member.summary: Defines the `IEditCell` object to customize default edit cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttColumn.EditType
member.summary: Defines the type of component for editing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttColumn.Field
member.summary: Defines the field name of column which is mapped with mapping name of DataSource. The `field` name must be a valid JavaScript identifier, the first character must be an alphabet and should not contain spaces and special characters.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttColumn.Filter
member.summary: It is used to customize the default filter options for a specific columns. ui - to render custom component for specific column it has following functions. ui.create It is used for creating custom components. ui.read - It is used for read the value from the component. ui.write - It is used to apply component model as dynamically.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttColumn.Format
member.summary: It is used to change display value with the given format and does not affect the original data. Gets the format from the user which can be standard or custom [`number`](../../../common/internationalization/#number-formatting) and [`date`](../../../common/internationalization/#formatting) formats.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttColumn.Formatter

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.Gantt.Toolbar
member.summary:
`toolbar` defines the toolbar items of the Gantt. It contains built-in and custom toolbar items. If an array value is assigned, it is considered as the list of built-in and custom toolbar items in the Gantt's toolbar.
The available built-in toolbar items are: Add: Adds a new record. Edit: Edits the selected task. Update: Updates the edited task. Delete: Deletes the selected task. Cancel: Cancels the edit state. Search: Searches tasks by the given key. ExpandAll: Expands all the task of Gantt. CollapseAll: Collapses all the task of Gantt. PrevTimeSpan: Extends timeline with one unit before the timeline start date. NextTimeSpan: Extends timeline with one unit after the timeline finish date. ZoomIn: ZoomIn the Gantt control. ZoomOut: ZoomOut the Gantt control. ZoomToFit: Display the all tasks within the viewable Gantt chart. ExcelExport: To export in Excel format CsvExport : To export in CSV format

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttBuilder.Toolbar(System.Object)
member.summary:
`toolbar` defines the toolbar items of the Gantt. It contains built-in and custom toolbar items. If an array value is assigned, it is considered as the list of built-in and custom toolbar items in the Gantt's toolbar.
The available built-in toolbar items are: Add: Adds a new record. Edit: Edits the selected task. Update: Updates the edited task. Delete: Deletes the selected task. Cancel: Cancels the edit state. Search: Searches tasks by the given key. ExpandAll: Expands all the task of Gantt. CollapseAll: Collapses all the task of Gantt. PrevTimeSpan: Extends timeline with one unit before the timeline start date. NextTimeSpan: Extends timeline with one unit after the timeline finish date. ZoomIn: ZoomIn the Gantt control. ZoomOut: ZoomOut the Gantt control. ZoomToFit: Display the all tasks within the viewable Gantt chart. ExcelExport: To export in Excel format CsvExport : To export in CSV format

member.summary: Defines the cell content's overflow mode. The available modes are `Clip` - Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area. `Ellipsis` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area. `EllipsisWithTooltip` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area also it will display tooltip while hover on ellipsis applied cell.

member.summary: It is used to customize the default filter options for a specific columns. ui - to render custom component for specific column it has following functions. ui.create It is used for creating custom components. ui.read - It is used for read the value from the component. ui.write - It is used to apply component model as dynamically.

member.summary: Enables or disables tooltip of Gantt element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttTooltipSettings.Taskbar
member.summary: Defines tooltip template for taskbar elements.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Gantt.GanttTooltipSettings.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.ColumnQueryModeType
member.summary: `columnQueryMode`provides options to retrive data from the datasource. They are All Schema ExcludeHidden

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridLine
member.summary: Defines modes of GridLine, They are Both - Displays both the horizontal and vertical grid lines. None - No grid lines are displayed. Horizontal - Displays the horizontal grid lines only. Vertical - Displays the vertical grid lines only. Default - Displays grid lines based on the theme.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.HierarchyGridPrintMode
member.summary: Hierarchy Grid Print modes are `Expanded` - Prints the master grid with expanded child grids. `All` - Prints the master grid with all the child grids. `None` - Prints the master grid alone.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.PrintMode
member.summary: Print mode options are AllPages - Print all pages records of the Grid. CurrentPage - Print current page records of the Grid.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.ClipMode
member.summary: Defines the cell content's overflow mode. The available modes are `Clip` - Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area. `Ellipsis` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area. `EllipsisWithTooltip` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area also it will display tooltip while hover on ellipsis applied cell.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.TextAlign
member.summary: Defines alignments of text, they are Left Right Center Justify

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.AggregateType
member.summary: Defines the aggregate types.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.FilterBarMode
member.summary: Filter bar mode options are OnEnter - Initiate filter operation after Enter key is pressed. Immediate - Initiate filter operation after certain time interval. By default time interval is 1500 ms.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.FilterType
member.summary: Defines types of Filter Menu - Specifies the filter type as menu. Excel - Specifies the filter type as excel. FilterBar - Specifies the filter type as filter bar. CheckBox - Specifies the filter type as check box.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.EditMode
member.summary: Defines modes of editing. Normal Dialog Batch

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.NewRowPosition
member.summary: Defines adding new row position. Top Bottom

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.CellSelectionMode
member.summary: Defines mode of cell selection. Flow Box

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.CheckboxSelectionType
member.summary: Defines modes of checkbox Selection. They are Default ResetOnRowClick

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.SelectionMode
member.summary: Defines modes of Selection, They are Row Cell Both

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.SelectionType
member.summary: Defines types of Selection. They are Single - Allows user to select a row or cell. Multiple - Allows user to select multiple rows or cells.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.WrapMode
member.summary: Defines the wrap mode. Both - Wraps both header and content. Header - Wraps header alone. Content - Wraps content alone.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.ColumnName
member.summary: Defines the column name to display the aggregate value. If `columnName` is not defined, then `field` name value will be assigned to the `columnName` property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.CustomAggregate
member.summary: Defines a function to calculate custom aggregate value. The `type` value should be set to `custom`. To use custom aggregate value in the template, use the key as `${custom}`. Total aggregation: The custom function will be called with the whole data and the current `AggregateColumn` object. Group aggregation: This will be called with the current group details and the `AggregateColumn` object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.Field
member.summary: Defines the column name to perform aggregation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Defines the footer cell template as a string for the aggregate column. The `type` name should be used to access aggregate values inside the template.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.Format
member.summary: Format is applied to a calculated value before it is displayed. Gets the format from the user, which can be standard or custom [`number`](../../common/internationalization/#number-formatting/) and [`date`](../../common/internationalization/#number-formatting/) formats.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.GroupCaptionTemplate
member.summary: Defines the group caption cell template as a string for the aggregate column. The `type` name should be used to access aggregate values inside the template. Additionally, the following fields can be accessed in the template. field: The current grouped field name. key: The current grouped field value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.GroupFooterTemplate
member.summary: Defines the group footer cell template as a string for the aggregate column. The `type` name should be used to access aggregate values inside the template. Additionally, the following fields can be accessed in the template. field: The current grouped field. key: The current grouped value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.Type
member.summary: Defines the aggregate type of a particular column. To use multiple aggregates for single column, specify the `type` as array. Types of aggregate are, sum average max min count truecount falsecount custom > Specify the `type` value as `custom` to use custom aggregation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridAggregateColumn.CustomFormat
member.summary: It is used to change display value with the given format and does not affect the original data. Gets the format from the user which can be standard or custom [`number`](../common/intl.html#number-formatter-and-parser) and [`date`](../common/intl.html#date-formatter-and-parser) formats.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridAggregate.Columns
member.summary: Configures the aggregate columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.AllowEditing
member.summary: If `allowEditing` set to false, then it disables editing of a particular column. By default all columns are editable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.AllowFiltering
member.summary: If `allowFiltering` set to false, then it disables filtering option and filter bar element of a particular column. By default all columns are filterable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.AllowGrouping
member.summary: If `allowGrouping` set to false, then it disables grouping of a particular column. By default all columns are groupable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.AllowReordering
member.summary: If `allowReordering` set to false, then it disables reorder of a particular column. By default all columns can be reorder.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.AllowResizing
member.summary: If `allowResizing` set to false, it disables resize option of a particular column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.AllowSearching
member.summary: If `allowSearching` set to false, then it disables Searching of a particular column. By default all columns allow Searching.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.AllowSorting
member.summary: If `allowSorting` set to false, then it disables sorting option of a particular column. By default all columns are sortable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.AutoFit
member.summary: If `autoFit` set to true, then the particular column content width will be adjusted based on its content in the initial rendering itself. Setting this property as true is equivalent to calling `autoFitColumns` method in the `dataBound` event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.ClipMode
member.summary: Defines the cell content's overflow mode. The available modes are `Clip` - Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area. `Ellipsis` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area. `EllipsisWithTooltip` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area also it will display tooltip while hover on ellipsis applied cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.Columns
member.summary: Used to render multiple header rows(stacked headers) on the Grid header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.Commands
member.summary: `commands` provides an option to display command buttons in every cell. The available built-in command buttons are Edit - Edit the record. Delete - Delete the record. Save - Save the record. Cancel - Cancel the edit state.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.CustomAttributes
member.summary: The CSS styles and attributes of the content cells of a particular column can be customized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.DataSource
member.summary: Defines the column data source which will act as foreign data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.DefaultValue
member.summary: Defines default values for the component when adding a new record to the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.DisableHtmlEncode
member.summary: If `disableHtmlEncode` is set to true, it encodes the HTML of the header and content cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.DisplayAsCheckBox
member.summary: If `displayAsCheckBox` is set to true, it displays the column value as a check box instead of Boolean value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.Edit
member.summary: Defines the `IEditCell` object to customize default edit cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.EditType
member.summary: Defines the type of component for editing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.EnableGroupByFormat
member.summary: If `enableGroupByFormat` set to true, then it groups the particular column by formatted values. By default no columns are group by format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.Field
member.summary: Defines the field name of column which is mapped with mapping name of DataSource. The bounded columns can be sort, filter and group etc., If the `field` name contains dot, then it is considered as complex binding. The `field` name must be a valid JavaScript identifier, the first character must be an alphabet and should not contain spaces and special characters.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.Filter
member.summary: Defines the filter options to customize filtering for the particular column. @default null

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.FilterBarTemplate
member.summary: The `filterBarTemplate` is used to add a custom component instead of default input component for filter bar. It have create and read functions. create: It is used for creating custom components. read: It is used to perform custom filter action.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.ForeignKeyField
member.summary: Defines the mapping column name of the foreign data source. If it is not defined then the `columns.field` will be considered as mapping column name

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.ForeignKeyValue
member.summary: Defines the display column name from the foreign data source which will be obtained from comparing local and foreign data

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.Format
member.summary: It is used to change display value with the given format and does not affect the original data. Gets the format from the user which can be standard or custom [`number`](../../common/internationalization/#number-formatting/) and [`date`](../common/internationalization/#number-formatting/) formats.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.Formatter
member.summary: Defines the method which is used to achieve custom formatting from an external function. This function triggers before rendering of each cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Defines the column template as string or HTML element ID which is used to add customized element in the column header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.HeaderText
member.summary: Defines the header text of column which is used to display in column header. If `headerText` is not defined, then field name value will be assigned to header text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.HeaderTextAlign
member.summary: Define the alignment of column header which is used to align the text of column header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.HideAtMedia
member.summary: column visibility can change based on its [`Media Queries`](http://cssmediaqueries.com/what-are-css-media-queries.html). `hideAtMedia` accepts only valid Media Queries.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.Index
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier value of the column. It is used to get the object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.IsFrozen
member.summary: You can use this property to freeze selected columns in grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.IsIdentity
member.summary: If `isIdentity` is set to true, then this column is considered as identity column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.IsPrimaryKey
member.summary: If `isPrimaryKey` is set to true, considers this column as the primary key constraint.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.LockColumn
member.summary: Defines the mapping column name of the foreign data source. If it is not defined then the `columns.field` will be considered as mapping column name

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.MaxWidth
member.summary: Defines the maximum width of the column in pixel or percentage, which will restrict resizing beyond this pixel or percentage.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.MinWidth
member.summary: Defines the minimum width of the column in pixels or percentage.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.ShowColumnMenu
member.summary: If `showColumnMenu` set to false, then it disable the column menu of a particular column. By default column menu will show for all columns

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.ShowInColumnChooser
member.summary: If `showInColumnChooser` set to false, then hides the particular column in column chooser. By default all columns are displayed in column Chooser.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.SortComparer
member.summary: It defines the custom sort comparer function.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.Template
member.summary: Defines the column template that renders customized element in each cell of the column. It accepts either [template string](../../common/template-engine/) or HTML element ID.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.TextAlign
member.summary: Defines the alignment of the column in both header and content cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.Type
member.summary: Defines the data type of the column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.Uid
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier value of the column. It is used to get the object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.ValidationRules
member.summary: Defines rules to validate data before creating and updating.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.ValueAccessor
member.summary: Defines the method used to apply custom cell values from external function and display this on each cell rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.Visible
member.summary: If `visible` is set to false, hides the particular column. By default, all columns are displayed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.Width
member.summary: Defines the width of the column in pixels or percentage.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridColumn.CustomFormat
member.summary: It is used to change display value with the given format and does not affect the original data. Gets the format from the user which can be standard or custom [`number`](../common/intl.html#number-formatter-and-parser) and [`date`](../common/intl.html#date-formatter-and-parser) formats.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridEditSettings.AllowAdding
member.summary: If `allowAdding` is set to true, new records can be added to the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridEditSettings.AllowDeleting
member.summary: If `allowDeleting` is set to true, existing record can be deleted from the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridEditSettings.AllowEditOnDblClick
member.summary: If `allowEditOnDblClick` is set to false, Grid will not allow editing of a record on double click.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridEditSettings.AllowEditing
member.summary: If `allowEditing` is set to true, values can be updated in the existing record.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridEditSettings.AllowNextRowEdit
member.summary: If allowNextRowEdit is set to true, editing is done to next row. By default allowNextRowEdit is set to false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridEditSettings.Dialog
member.summary: Defines the dialog params to edit.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridEditSettings.Mode
member.summary: Defines the mode to edit. The available editing modes are: Normal Dialog Batch

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridEditSettings.NewRowPosition
member.summary: Defines the position of adding a new row. The available position are: Top Bottom

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridEditSettings.ShowConfirmDialog
member.summary: if `showConfirmDialog` is set to false, confirm dialog does not show when batch changes are saved or discarded.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridEditSettings.ShowDeleteConfirmDialog
member.summary: If `showDeleteConfirmDialog` is set to true, confirm dialog will show delete action. You can also cancel delete command.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridEditSettings.Template
member.summary: Defines the custom edit elements for the dialog template.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridEditSettings.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridFilterSettings.Columns
member.summary: Specifies the columns to be filtered at initial rendering of the Grid. You can also get the columns that were currently filtered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridFilterSettings.EnableCaseSensitivity
member.summary: If `enableCaseSensitivity` is set to true then searches grid records with exact match based on the filter operator. It will have no effect on number, boolean and Date fields.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridFilterSettings.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: If ignoreAccent set to true, then filter ignores the diacritic characters or accents while filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridFilterSettings.ImmediateModeDelay
member.summary: Defines the time delay (in milliseconds) in filtering records when the `Immediate` mode of filter bar is set.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridFilterSettings.Mode
member.summary: Defines the filter bar modes. The available options are, `OnEnter`: Initiates filter operation after Enter key is pressed. `Immediate`: Initiates filter operation after a certain time interval. By default, time interval is 1500 ms.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridFilterSettings.Operators
member.summary: The `operators` is used to override the default operators in filter menu. This should be defined by type wise (string, number, date and boolean). Based on the column type, this customize operator list will render in filter menu.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridFilterSettings.ShowFilterBarStatus
member.summary: Shows or hides the filtered status message on the pager.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridFilterSettings.Type
member.summary: Defines options for filtering type. The available options are `Menu` - Specifies the filter type as menu. `CheckBox` - Specifies the filter type as checkbox. `FilterBar` - Specifies the filter type as filterbar. `Excel` - Specifies the filter type as checkbox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridFilterSettings.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.Aggregates
member.summary: Configures the Grid aggregate rows. > Check the [`Aggregates`](../../grid/aggregates/) for its configuration.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowExcelExport
member.summary: If `allowExcelExport` set to true, then it will allow the user to export grid to Excel file.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowFiltering
member.summary: If `allowFiltering` set to true the filter bar will be displayed. If set to false the filter bar will not be displayed. Filter bar allows the user to filter grid records with required criteria.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowGrouping
member.summary: If `allowGrouping` set to true, then it will allow the user to dynamically group or ungroup columns. Grouping can be done by drag and drop columns from column header to group drop area.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowMultiSorting
member.summary: If `allowMultiSorting` set to true, then it will allow the user to sort multiple column in the grid. > `allowSorting` should be true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowPaging
member.summary: If `allowPaging` is set to true, the pager renders at the footer of the Grid. It is used to handle page navigation in the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowPdfExport
member.summary: If `allowPdfExport` set to true, then it will allow the user to export grid to Pdf file.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowReordering
member.summary: If `allowReordering` is set to true, Grid columns can be reordered. Reordering can be done by drag and drop of a particular column from one index to another index. > If Grid is rendered with stacked headers, reordering is allowed only at the same level as the column headers.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowResizing
member.summary: If `allowResizing` is set to true, Grid columns can be resized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowRowDragAndDrop
member.summary: If `allowRowDragAndDrop` is set to true, you can drag and drop grid rows at another grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowSelection
member.summary: If `allowSelection` is set to true, it allows selection of (highlight row) Grid records by clicking it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowSorting
member.summary: If `allowSorting` is set to true, it allows sorting of grid records when column header is clicked.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.AllowTextWrap
member.summary: If `allowTextWrap` set to true, then text content will wrap to the next line when its text content exceeds the width of the Column Cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.ChildGrid
member.summary: Defines Grid options to render child Grid. It requires the [`queryString`](grid/#querystring-string) for parent and child relationship.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.ColumnMenuItems
member.summary:
`columnMenuItems` defines both built-in and custom column menu items.
The available built-in items are, `AutoFitAll` - Auto fit the size of all columns. `AutoFit` - Auto fit the current column. `Group` - Group by current column. `Ungroup` - Ungroup by current column. `SortAscending` - Sort the current column in ascending order. `SortDescending` - Sort the current column in descending order. `Filter` - Filter options will show based on filterSettings property like checkbox filter, excel filter, menu filter.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.ColumnQueryMode
member.summary: `columnQueryMode`provides options to retrive data from the datasource.Their types are `All`: It Retrives whole datasource. `Schema`: Retrives data for all the defined columns in grid from the datasource. `ExcludeHidden`: Retrives data only for visible columns of grid from the dataSource.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.Columns
member.summary: Defines the schema of dataSource. If the `columns` declaration is empty or undefined then the `columns` are automatically generated from data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.ContextMenuItems
member.summary:
`contextMenuItems` defines both built-in and custom context menu items.
The available built-in items are, `AutoFitAll` - Auto fit the size of all columns. `AutoFit` - Auto fit the current column. `Group` - Group by current column. `Ungroup` - Ungroup by current column. `Edit` - Edit the current record. `Delete` - Delete the current record. `Save` - Save the edited record. `Cancel` - Cancel the edited state. `Copy` - Copy the selected records. `PdfExport` - Export the grid as Pdf format. `ExcelExport` - Export the grid as Excel format. `CsvExport` - Export the grid as CSV format. `SortAscending` - Sort the current column in ascending order. `SortDescending` - Sort the current column in descending order. `FirstPage` - Go to the first page. `PrevPage` - Go to the previous page. `LastPage` - Go to the last page. `NextPage` - Go to the next page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.DataSource
member.summary: It is used to render grid table rows. If the `dataSource` is an array of JavaScript objects, then Grid will create instance of [`DataManager`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/api-dataManager.html) from this `dataSource`. If the `dataSource` is an existing [`DataManager`](https://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/api-dataManager.html), the Grid will not initialize a new one.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.DetailTemplate
member.summary: The detail template allows you to show or hide additional information about a particular row.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.EditSettings
member.summary: Configures the edit settings.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.EnableAltRow
member.summary: If `enableAltRow` is set to true, the grid will render with `e-altrow` CSS class to the alternative tr elements. > Check the [`AltRow`](../../grid/row/#styling-alternate-rows/) to customize the styles of alternative rows.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.EnableAutoFill
member.summary: If `enableAutoFill` is set to true, then the auto fill icon will displayed on cell selection for copy cells. It requires the selection `mode` to be Cell and `cellSelectionMode` to be `Box`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.EnableColumnVirtualization
member.summary: If `enableColumnVirtualization` set to true, then the Grid will render only the columns visible within the view-port and load subsequent columns on horizontal scrolling. This helps to load large dataset of columns in Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.EnableHover
member.summary: If `enableHover` is set to true, the row hover is enabled in the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.EnableVirtualization
member.summary: If `enableVirtualization` set to true, then the Grid will render only the rows visible within the view-port and load subsequent rows on vertical scrolling. This helps to load large dataset in Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.FilterSettings
member.summary: Configures the filter settings of the Grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.FrozenColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frozen columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.FrozenRows
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of frozen rows.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.GridLines
member.summary: Defines the mode of grid lines. The available modes are, `Both`: Displays both horizontal and vertical grid lines. `None`: No grid lines are displayed. `Horizontal`: Displays the horizontal grid lines only. `Vertical`: Displays the vertical grid lines only. `Default`: Displays grid lines based on the theme.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.Grid.Toolbar
member.summary:
`toolbar` defines the ToolBar items of the Grid. It contains built-in and custom toolbar items. If a string value is assigned to the `toolbar` option, it is considered as the template for the whole Grid ToolBar. If an array value is assigned, it is considered as the list of built-in and custom toolbar items in the Grid's Toolbar.
The following code example implements the custom toolbar items.
