member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettings.AllowAdding
member.summary: When set to `false` the add action will be restricted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettings.AllowDeleting
member.summary: When set to `false` the delete action will be restricted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettings.AllowEditing
member.summary: When set to `false` the edit action will be restricted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettings.DataSource
member.summary: With this property, the event data will be bound to Schedule. The event data can be passed either as an array of JavaScript objects, or else can create an instance of [`DataManager`](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/api-dataManager.html) in case of processing remote data and can be assigned to the `dataSource` property. With the remote data assigned to dataSource, check the available [adaptors](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/adaptors.html) to customize the data processing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettings.EditFollowingEvents
member.summary: When set to `true` will edit the future events only instead of editing entire series.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettings.EnableTooltip
member.summary: When set to `true` will display the normal tooltip over the events with its subject, location, start and end time.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettings.Fields
member.summary: Defines the collection of default event fields to be bind to the Schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettings.Query
member.summary: Defines the external [`query`](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/api-query.html) that will be executed along with the data processing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettings.ResourceColorField
P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettings.Template
P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettings.TooltipTemplate
P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettings.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.Description
member.summary: It maps the `description` field from the dataSource and denotes the event description which is optional.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.EndTime
member.summary: The `endTime` field defines the end time of an event and it is mandatory to provide the end time for any of the valid event objects.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.EndTimezone
member.summary: It maps the `endTimezone` field from the dataSource and usually accepts the valid IANA timezone names. It is assumed that the value provided for this field is taken into consideration while processing the `endTime` field. When this field is not mapped with any timezone names, then the events will be processed based on the timezone assigned to the Schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.FollowingID
member.summary: The `followingID` field is mapped from dataSource and usually holds the ID value of the main parent event.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.Id
member.summary: The `id` field needs to be defined as mandatory, when the Schedule is bound to remote data and it is optional, if the same is bound with JSON data. This field usually assigns ID value to each of the events.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.IsAllDay
member.summary: The `isAllDay` field is mapped from the dataSource and is used to denote whether an event is created for an entire day or for specific time alone.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.IsBlock
member.summary: The `isBlock` field allows you to block certain time interval on the Scheduler. It is a boolean type property accepting either true or false values. When set to true, creates a block range for the specified time interval and disables the event scheduling actions on that time range.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.IsReadonly
member.summary: The `isReadonly` field is mapped from the dataSource and is used to prevent the CRUD actions on specific events.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.Location
member.summary: It maps the `location` field from the dataSource and the location field value will be displayed over events, while given it for an event object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.RecurrenceException
member.summary: It maps the `recurrenceException` field from dataSource and is used to hold the exception dates which needs to be excluded from recurring type.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.RecurrenceID
member.summary: It maps the `recurrenceID` field from dataSource and usually holds the ID value of the parent recurrence event. It is applicable only for the edited occurrence events.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.RecurrenceRule
member.summary: It maps the `recurrenceRule` field from dataSource and is used to uniquely identify whether the event belongs to a recurring event type or normal ones.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.StartTime
member.summary: The `startTime` field defines the start time of an event and it is mandatory to provide it for any of the valid event objects.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.StartTimezone
member.summary: It maps the `startTimezone` field from the dataSource and usually accepts the valid IANA timezone names. It is assumed that the value provided for this field is taken into consideration while processing the `startTime` field. When this field is not mapped with any timezone names, then the events will be processed based on the timezone assigned to the Schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.Subject
member.summary: The `subject` field is optional, and usually assigns the subject text to each of the events.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptions.Default
member.summary: Assigns the specific default value to the fields, when no values are provided to those fields from dataSource.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptions.Name
member.summary: Denotes the field name to be mapped from the dataSource for every event fields.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptions.Title
member.summary: Assigns the label values to be displayed for the event editor fields.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptions.Validation
member.summary: Defines the validation rules to be applied on the event fields within the event editor. {% codeBlock src="schedule/validation-api/index.ts" %}{% endcodeBlock %}

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptions.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleGroup.AllowGroupEdit
member.summary: Allows creation and editing of linked appointments assigned to multiple resources. When set to `true`, a single appointment object instance will be maintained in schedule dataSource that are created for multiple resources, whereas displayed individually on UI.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleGroup.ByDate
member.summary: When set to `true`, groups the resources by date where each day renders all the resource names under it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleGroup.ByGroupID
member.summary: Decides whether to allow the resource hierarchy to group by ID. It is set to `true` by default and when set to false, all the resources under child collection will be mapped against each available parent.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleGroup.EnableCompactView
member.summary: Decides whether to display the resource grouping layout in normal or compact mode in mobile devices. When set to `false`, the default grouping layout on desktop will be displayed on mobile devices with scrolling enabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleGroup.HeaderTooltipTemplate
member.summary: Template option to customize the tooltip that displays over the resource header bar. By default, no tooltip will be displayed on resource header bar. It accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design content and parse it appropriately before displaying it onto the tooltip. All the resource fields mapped for resource dataSource can be accessed within this template code.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleGroup.Resources
member.summary: Accepts the collection of resource names assigned to each resources and allows the grouping order on schedule based on it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleGroup.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleHeaderRow.Option
member.summary: It defines the header row type, which accepts either of the following values. Year Month Week Date Hour

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleHeaderRow.Template
member.summary: Template option to customize the individual header rows. It accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design content and parse it appropriately before displaying it onto the header cells. The field that can be accessed via this template is `date`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleQuickInfoTemplates.Content
member.summary: Template option to customize the content area of the quick popup. @default null

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleQuickInfoTemplates.Footer
member.summary: Template option to customize the footer section of quick popup. @default null

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleQuickInfoTemplates.Header
member.summary: Template option to customize the header section of quick popup. @default null

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleQuickInfoTemplates.TemplateType
member.summary: Template option to customize the header section of quick popup. @default 'Both'

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleQuickInfoTemplates.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResource.AllowMultiple
member.summary: When set to true, allows multiple selection of resource names, thus creating multiple instances of same appointment for the selected resources.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResource.ColorField
member.summary: It maps the `color` field from the dataSource, which is used to specify colors for the resources.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResource.CssClassField
member.summary: It maps the `cssClass` field from the dataSource, which is used to specify different styles to each resource appointments.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResource.DataSource
member.summary: Assigns the resource dataSource The data can be passed either as an array of JavaScript objects, or else can create an instance of [`DataManager`](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/api-dataManager.html) in case of processing remote data and can be assigned to the `dataSource` property. With the remote data assigned to dataSource, check the available [adaptors](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/adaptors.html) to customize the data processing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResource.EndHourField
member.summary: It maps the `endHour` field from the dataSource, which is used to specify different work end hour for each resources.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResource.ExpandedField
member.summary: It maps the `expanded` field from the dataSource, which is used to specify whether each resource levels in timeline view needs to be maintained in an expanded or collapsed state by default.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResource.Field
member.summary: A value that binds to the resource field of event object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResource.GroupIDField
member.summary: It maps the `groupID` field from the dataSource, which is used to specify under which parent resource, the child should be grouped.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResource.IdField
member.summary: It maps the `id` field from the dataSource and is used to uniquely identify the resources.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResource.Name
member.summary: It represents a unique resource name for differentiating various resource objects while grouping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResource.Query
member.summary: Defines the external [`query`](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/api-query.html) that will be executed along with the data processing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResource.StartHourField
member.summary: It maps the `startHour` field from the dataSource, which is used to specify different work start hour for each resources.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResource.TextField
member.summary: It maps the `text` field from the dataSource, which is used to specify the resource names.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResource.Title
member.summary: It holds the title of the resource field to be displayed on the schedule event editor window.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResource.WorkDaysField
member.summary: It maps the working days field from the dataSource, which is used to specify different working days for each resources.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.AgendaDaysCount
member.summary: Sets the number of days to be displayed by default in Agenda View and in case of virtual scrolling, the number of days will be fetched on each scroll-end based on this count.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.AllowDragAndDrop
member.summary: When set to `true`, allows the appointments to move over the time slots. When an appointment is dragged, both its start and end time tends to change simultaneously allowing it to reschedule the appointment on some other time.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.AllowKeyboardInteraction
member.summary: When set to `true`, allows the keyboard interaction to take place on Schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.AllowResizing
member.summary: When set to `true`, allows the resizing of appointments. It allows the rescheduling of appointments either by changing the start or end time by dragging the event resize handlers.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.CalendarMode
member.summary: It allows the Scheduler to display in other calendar modes. By default, Scheduler is displayed in `Gregorian` calendar mode. To change the mode, you can set either `Gregorian` or `Islamic` as a value to this `calendarMode` property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.CellHeaderTemplate
member.summary: It accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design content and parse it appropriately before displaying it onto the month date cells. This template is only applicable for month view day cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.CellTemplate
member.summary: The template option which is used to render the customized work cells on the Schedule. Here, the template accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design and then the parsed design is displayed onto the work cells. The fields accessible via template are as follows. date groupIndex type {% codeBlock src="schedule/cell-template-api/index.html" %}{% endcodeBlock %} {% codeBlock src="schedule/cell-template-api/index.ts" %}{% endcodeBlock %}

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.CssClass
member.summary: It is used to customize the Schedule which accepts custom CSS class names that defines specific user-defined styles and themes to be applied on the Schedule element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.CurrentView
member.summary: To set the active view on scheduler, the `currentView` property can be used and it usually accepts either of the following available view options. The view option specified in this property will be initially loaded on the schedule. Day Week WorkWeek Month Agenda MonthAgenda TimelineDay TimelineWeek TimelineWorkWeek TimelineMonth

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.DateFormat
member.summary: By default, Schedule follows the date-format as per the default culture assigned to it. It is also possible to manually set specific date format by using the `dateFormat` property. The format of the date range label in the header bar depends on the `dateFormat` value or else based on the locale assigned to the Schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.DateHeaderTemplate
P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.EditorTemplate
P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.EnableRecurrenceValidation
member.summary: The recurrence validation will be done by default When this property is set to `false`, the recurrence validation will be skipped.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.EndHour
member.summary: It is used to specify the end hour, at which the Schedule ends. It too accepts the time string in a short skeleton format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.EventDragArea
member.summary: It enables the external drag and drop support for appointments on scheduler, to be able to move them out of the scheduler layout. When the drag area is explicitly set with specific DOM element name, the appointments can be dragged anywhere within the specified drag area location.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.EventSettings
member.summary: Complete set of settings related to Schedule events to bind it to local or remote dataSource, map applicable database fields and other validation to be carried out on the available fields.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: This option allows the user to set the first day of a week on Schedule. It should be based on the locale set to it and each culture defines its own first day of week values. If needed, the user can set it manually on his own by defining the value through this property. It usually accepts the integer values, whereby 0 is always denoted as Sunday, 1 as Monday and so on.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.Group
P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.HeaderRows
P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.Height
member.summary: Sets the `height` of the Schedule component, accepting both string and number values. The string type includes either pixel or percentage values. When `height` is set with specific pixel value, then the Schedule will be rendered to that specified space. In case, if `auto` value is set, then the height of the Schedule gets auto-adjusted within the given container.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.HideEmptyAgendaDays
member.summary: The days which does not has even a single event to display will be hidden from the UI of Agenda View by default. When this property is set to `false`, the empty dates will also be displayed on the Schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.QuickInfoTemplates
P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.Readonly
member.summary: When set to `true`, makes the Schedule to render in a read only mode. No CRUD actions will be allowed at this time.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.ResourceHeaderTemplate
member.summary: Template option to customize the resource header bar. Here, the template accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design and then the parsed design is displayed onto the resource header cells. The following can be accessible via template. resource - All the resource fields. resourceData - object collection of current resource. {% codeBlock src="schedule/resource-header-api/index.html" %}{% endcodeBlock %} {% codeBlock src="schedule/resource-header-api/index.ts" %}{% endcodeBlock %}

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.Resources
P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.RowAutoHeight
member.summary: when set to `true`, allows the height of the work-cells to adjust automatically based on the number of appointments present in those time ranges.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.SelectedDate
member.summary: To mark the active (current) date on the Schedule, `selectedDate` property can be defined. Usually, it defaults to the current System date.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.ShowHeaderBar
member.summary: When set to `false`, hides the header bar of the Schedule from UI. By default, the header bar holds the date and view navigation options, to which the user can add their own custom items onto it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.ShowQuickInfo
member.summary: When set to `true`, displays a quick popup with cell or event details on single clicking over the cells or on events. By default, it is set to `true`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.ShowTimeIndicator
member.summary: When set to `false`, hides the current time indicator from the Schedule. Otherwise, it visually depicts the live current system time appropriately on the user interface.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.ShowWeekNumber
member.summary: When set to `true`, displays the week number of the current view date range. By default, it is set to `false`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.ShowWeekend
member.summary: When set to `false`, it hides the weekend days of a week from the Schedule. The days which are not defined in the working days collection are usually treated as weekend days. Note: By default, this option is not applicable on `Work Week` view. For example, if the working days are defined as [1, 2, 3, 4], then the remaining days of that week will be considered as the weekend days and will be hidden on all the views.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.StartHour
member.summary: It is used to specify the starting hour, from which the Schedule starts to display. It accepts the time string in a short skeleton format and also, hides the time beyond the specified start time.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.TimeScale
P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.Timezone
member.summary: Schedule will be assigned with specific timezone, so as to display the events in it accordingly. By default, Schedule dates are processed with System timezone, as no timezone will be assigned specifically to the Schedule at the initial time. Whenever the Schedule is bound to remote data services, it is always recommended to set specific timezone to Schedule to make the events on it to display on the same time irrespective of the system timezone. It usually accepts the valid [IANA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) timezone names.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.Views
member.summary: This property holds the views collection and its configurations. It accepts either the array of view names or the array of view objects that holds different configurations for each views. By default, Schedule displays all the views namely `Day`, `Week`, `Work Week`, `Month` and `Agenda`. Example for array of views: {% codeBlock src="schedule/view-api/index.ts" %}{% endcodeBlock %} Example for array of view objects: {% codeBlock src="schedule/view-api/array.ts" %}{% endcodeBlock %}

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.Width
member.summary: Sets the `width` of the Schedule component, accepting both string and number values. The string value can be either pixel or percentage format. When set to `auto`, the Schedule width gets auto-adjusted and display its content related to the viewable screen size.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.WorkDays
member.summary: It is used to set the working days on Schedule. The only days that are defined in this collection will be rendered on the `workWeek` view whereas on other views, it will display all the usual days and simply highlights the working days with different shade.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Schedule.WorkHours
member.summary: The working hours should be highlighted on Schedule with different color shade and an additional option must be provided to highlight it or not. This functionality is handled through `workHours` property and the start work hour should be 9 AM by default and end work hour should point to 6 PM. The start and end working hours needs to be provided as Time value of short skeleton type.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.HtmlAttributes(System.Object)
member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.AgendaDaysCount(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the number of days to be displayed by default in Agenda View and in case of virtual scrolling, the number of days will be fetched on each scroll-end based on this count.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.AllowDragAndDrop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When set to `true`, allows the appointments to move over the time slots. When an appointment is dragged, both its start and end time tends to change simultaneously allowing it to reschedule the appointment on some other time.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.AllowKeyboardInteraction(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When set to `true`, allows the keyboard interaction to take place on Schedule.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.AllowResizing(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When set to `true`, allows the resizing of appointments. It allows the rescheduling of appointments either by changing the start or end time by dragging the event resize handlers.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.CalendarMode(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.CalendarType)
member.summary: It allows the Scheduler to display in other calendar modes. By default, Scheduler is displayed in `Gregorian` calendar mode. To change the mode, you can set either `Gregorian` or `Islamic` as a value to this `calendarMode` property.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.CellHeaderTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: It accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design content and parse it appropriately before displaying it onto the month date cells. This template is only applicable for month view day cells.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.CellTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: The template option which is used to render the customized work cells on the Schedule. Here, the template accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design and then the parsed design is displayed onto the work cells. The fields accessible via template are as follows. date groupIndex type {% codeBlock src="schedule/cell-template-api/index.html" %}{% endcodeBlock %} {% codeBlock src="schedule/cell-template-api/index.ts" %}{% endcodeBlock %}

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.CssClass(System.String)
member.summary: It is used to customize the Schedule which accepts custom CSS class names that defines specific user-defined styles and themes to be applied on the Schedule element.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.CurrentView(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.View)
member.summary: To set the active view on scheduler, the `currentView` property can be used and it usually accepts either of the following available view options. The view option specified in this property will be initially loaded on the schedule. Day Week WorkWeek Month Agenda MonthAgenda TimelineDay TimelineWeek TimelineWorkWeek TimelineMonth

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.DateFormat(System.String)
member.summary: By default, Schedule follows the date-format as per the default culture assigned to it. It is also possible to manually set specific date format by using the `dateFormat` property. The format of the date range label in the header bar depends on the `dateFormat` value or else based on the locale assigned to the Schedule.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.DateHeaderTemplate(System.String)
M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.EditorTemplate(System.String)
M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.EnablePersistence(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.EnableRecurrenceValidation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: The recurrence validation will be done by default When this property is set to `false`, the recurrence validation will be skipped.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.EnableRtl(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.EndHour(System.String)
member.summary: It is used to specify the end hour, at which the Schedule ends. It too accepts the time string in a short skeleton format.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.EventDragArea(System.String)
member.summary: It enables the external drag and drop support for appointments on scheduler, to be able to move them out of the scheduler layout. When the drag area is explicitly set with specific DOM element name, the appointments can be dragged anywhere within the specified drag area location.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.EventSettings(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettings)
member.summary: Complete set of settings related to Schedule events to bind it to local or remote dataSource, map applicable database fields and other validation to be carried out on the available fields.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleBuilder.FirstDayOfWeek(System.Double)
member.summary: This option allows the user to set the first day of a week on Schedule. It should be based on the locale set to it and each culture defines its own first day of week values. If needed, the user can set it manually on his own by defining the value through this property. It usually accepts the integer values, whereby 0 is always denoted as Sunday, 1 as Monday and so on.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettingsBuilder.DataSource(System.Object)
member.summary: With this property, the event data will be bound to Schedule. The event data can be passed either as an array of JavaScript objects, or else can create an instance of [`DataManager`](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/api-dataManager.html) in case of processing remote data and can be assigned to the `dataSource` property. With the remote data assigned to dataSource, check the available [adaptors](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/adaptors.html) to customize the data processing.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettingsBuilder.EditFollowingEvents(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When set to `true` will edit the future events only instead of editing entire series.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettingsBuilder.EnableTooltip(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When set to `true` will display the normal tooltip over the events with its subject, location, start and end time.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettingsBuilder.Fields(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleField)
member.summary: Defines the collection of default event fields to be bind to the Schedule.

member.summary: Defines the external [`query`](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/api-query.html) that will be executed along with the data processing.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldBuilder.EndTime(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptions)
member.summary: The `endTime` field defines the end time of an event and it is mandatory to provide the end time for any of the valid event objects.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldBuilder.EndTimezone(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptions)
member.summary: It maps the `endTimezone` field from the dataSource and usually accepts the valid IANA timezone names. It is assumed that the value provided for this field is taken into consideration while processing the `endTime` field. When this field is not mapped with any timezone names, then the events will be processed based on the timezone assigned to the Schedule.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldBuilder.FollowingID(System.String)
member.summary: The `followingID` field is mapped from dataSource and usually holds the ID value of the main parent event.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldBuilder.Id(System.String)
member.summary: The `id` field needs to be defined as mandatory, when the Schedule is bound to remote data and it is optional, if the same is bound with JSON data. This field usually assigns ID value to each of the events.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldBuilder.IsAllDay(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptions)
member.summary: The `isAllDay` field is mapped from the dataSource and is used to denote whether an event is created for an entire day or for specific time alone.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldBuilder.IsBlock(System.String)
member.summary: The `isBlock` field allows you to block certain time interval on the Scheduler. It is a boolean type property accepting either true or false values. When set to true, creates a block range for the specified time interval and disables the event scheduling actions on that time range.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldBuilder.IsReadonly(System.String)
member.summary: The `isReadonly` field is mapped from the dataSource and is used to prevent the CRUD actions on specific events.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldBuilder.Location(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptions)
member.summary: It maps the `location` field from the dataSource and the location field value will be displayed over events, while given it for an event object.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldBuilder.RecurrenceException(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptions)
member.summary: It maps the `recurrenceException` field from dataSource and is used to hold the exception dates which needs to be excluded from recurring type.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldBuilder.RecurrenceID(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptions)
member.summary: It maps the `recurrenceID` field from dataSource and usually holds the ID value of the parent recurrence event. It is applicable only for the edited occurrence events.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldBuilder.RecurrenceRule(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptions)
member.summary: It maps the `recurrenceRule` field from dataSource and is used to uniquely identify whether the event belongs to a recurring event type or normal ones.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldBuilder.StartTime(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptions)
member.summary: The `startTime` field defines the start time of an event and it is mandatory to provide it for any of the valid event objects.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldBuilder.StartTimezone(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptions)
member.summary: It maps the `startTimezone` field from the dataSource and usually accepts the valid IANA timezone names. It is assumed that the value provided for this field is taken into consideration while processing the `startTime` field. When this field is not mapped with any timezone names, then the events will be processed based on the timezone assigned to the Schedule.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldBuilder.Subject(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptions)
member.summary: The `subject` field is optional, and usually assigns the subject text to each of the events.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptionsBuilder.Default(System.String)
member.summary: Assigns the specific default value to the fields, when no values are provided to those fields from dataSource.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptionsBuilder.Name(System.String)
member.summary: Denotes the field name to be mapped from the dataSource for every event fields.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptionsBuilder.Title(System.String)
member.summary: Assigns the label values to be displayed for the event editor fields.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleFieldOptionsBuilder.Validation(System.Object)
member.summary: Defines the validation rules to be applied on the event fields within the event editor. {% codeBlock src="schedule/validation-api/index.ts" %}{% endcodeBlock %}

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleGroupBuilder.AllowGroupEdit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows creation and editing of linked appointments assigned to multiple resources. When set to `true`, a single appointment object instance will be maintained in schedule dataSource that are created for multiple resources, whereas displayed individually on UI.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleGroupBuilder.ByDate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When set to `true`, groups the resources by date where each day renders all the resource names under it.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleGroupBuilder.ByGroupID(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Decides whether to allow the resource hierarchy to group by ID. It is set to `true` by default and when set to false, all the resources under child collection will be mapped against each available parent.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleGroupBuilder.EnableCompactView(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Decides whether to display the resource grouping layout in normal or compact mode in mobile devices. When set to `false`, the default grouping layout on desktop will be displayed on mobile devices with scrolling enabled.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleGroupBuilder.HeaderTooltipTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: Template option to customize the tooltip that displays over the resource header bar. By default, no tooltip will be displayed on resource header bar. It accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design content and parse it appropriately before displaying it onto the tooltip. All the resource fields mapped for resource dataSource can be accessed within this template code.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleGroupBuilder.Resources(System.String[])
member.summary: Accepts the collection of resource names assigned to each resources and allows the grouping order on schedule based on it.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleHeaderRowBuilder.Option(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.HeaderRowType)
member.summary: It defines the header row type, which accepts either of the following values. Year Month Week Date Hour

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleHeaderRowBuilder.Template(System.String)
member.summary: Template option to customize the individual header rows. It accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design content and parse it appropriately before displaying it onto the header cells. The field that can be accessed via this template is `date`.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleQuickInfoTemplatesBuilder.Content(System.String)
member.summary: Template option to customize the content area of the quick popup. @default null

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleQuickInfoTemplatesBuilder.Footer(System.String)
member.summary: Template option to customize the footer section of quick popup. @default null

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleQuickInfoTemplatesBuilder.Header(System.String)
member.summary: Template option to customize the header section of quick popup. @default null

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleQuickInfoTemplatesBuilder.TemplateType(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.TemplateType)
member.summary: Template option to customize the header section of quick popup. @default 'Both'

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResourceBuilder.AllowMultiple(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When set to true, allows multiple selection of resource names, thus creating multiple instances of same appointment for the selected resources.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResourceBuilder.ColorField(System.String)
member.summary: It maps the `color` field from the dataSource, which is used to specify colors for the resources.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResourceBuilder.CssClassField(System.String)
member.summary: It maps the `cssClass` field from the dataSource, which is used to specify different styles to each resource appointments.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResourceBuilder.DataSource(System.Object)
member.summary: Assigns the resource dataSource The data can be passed either as an array of JavaScript objects, or else can create an instance of [`DataManager`](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/api-dataManager.html) in case of processing remote data and can be assigned to the `dataSource` property. With the remote data assigned to dataSource, check the available [adaptors](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/adaptors.html) to customize the data processing.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResourceBuilder.EndHourField(System.String)
member.summary: It maps the `endHour` field from the dataSource, which is used to specify different work end hour for each resources.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResourceBuilder.ExpandedField(System.String)
member.summary: It maps the `expanded` field from the dataSource, which is used to specify whether each resource levels in timeline view needs to be maintained in an expanded or collapsed state by default.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResourceBuilder.Field(System.String)
member.summary: A value that binds to the resource field of event object.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResourceBuilder.GroupIDField(System.String)
member.summary: It maps the `groupID` field from the dataSource, which is used to specify under which parent resource, the child should be grouped.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResourceBuilder.IdField(System.String)
member.summary: It maps the `id` field from the dataSource and is used to uniquely identify the resources.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResourceBuilder.Name(System.String)
member.summary: It represents a unique resource name for differentiating various resource objects while grouping.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResourceBuilder.Query(System.String)
member.summary: Defines the external [`query`](http://ej2.syncfusion.com/documentation/data/api-query.html) that will be executed along with the data processing.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResourceBuilder.StartHourField(System.String)
member.summary: It maps the `startHour` field from the dataSource, which is used to specify different work start hour for each resources.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResourceBuilder.TextField(System.String)
member.summary: It maps the `text` field from the dataSource, which is used to specify the resource names.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResourceBuilder.Title(System.String)
member.summary: It holds the title of the resource field to be displayed on the schedule event editor window.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleResourceBuilder.WorkDaysField(System.String)
member.summary: It maps the working days field from the dataSource, which is used to specify different working days for each resources.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleTimeScaleBuilder.Enable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When set to `true`, allows the schedule to display the appointments accurately against the exact time duration. If set to `false`, all the appointments of a day will be displayed one below the other.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleTimeScaleBuilder.Interval(System.Double)
member.summary: Defines the time duration on which the time axis to be displayed either in 1 hour or 30 minutes interval and so on. It accepts the values in minutes.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleTimeScaleBuilder.MajorSlotTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: The template option to be applied for major time slot. Here, the template accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design and then the parsed design is displayed onto the time cells. The time details can be accessed within this template.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleTimeScaleBuilder.MinorSlotTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: The template option to be applied for minor time slot. Here, the template accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design and then the parsed design is displayed onto the time cells. The time details can be accessed within this template. @default null

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleTimeScaleBuilder.SlotCount(System.Double)
member.summary: Decides the number of slot count to be split for the specified time interval duration.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.AllowVirtualScrolling(System.Boolean)
member.summary: It is used to allow or disallow the virtual scrolling functionality on Agenda View. This is applicable only on Agenda view.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.CellHeaderTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: It accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design content and parse it appropriately before displaying it onto the month date cells. This template is only applicable for month view day cells.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.CellTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: The template option which is used to render the customized work cells on the Schedule. Here, the template accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design and then the parsed design is displayed onto the work cells. The field accessible via template is `date`. It gets applied only to the view objects on which it is defined.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.DateFormat(System.String)
member.summary: By default, Schedule follows the date-format as per the default culture assigned to it. It is also possible to manually set specific date format by using the `dateFormat` property. The format of the date range label in the header bar depends on the `dateFormat` value or else based on the locale assigned to the Schedule. It gets applied only to the view objects on which it is defined.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.DateHeaderTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: It accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design content and parse it appropriately before displaying it onto the date header cells. The field that can be accessed via this template is `date`. It gets applied only to the view objects on which it is defined.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.DisplayName(System.String)
member.summary: When the same view is customized with different intervals, this property allows the user to set different display name for those views.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.EndHour(System.String)
member.summary: It is used to specify the end hour, at which the Schedule ends. It too accepts the time string in a short skeleton format.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.EventTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: It accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design content and parse it appropriately before displaying it onto the event background. All the event fields mapped to Schedule from dataSource can be accessed within this template code. It is similar to that of the `template` option available within the `eventSettings` property, whereas it will get applied only on the events of the view to which it is currently being defined.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.FirstDayOfWeek(System.Double)
member.summary: This option allows the user to set the first day of a week on Schedule. It should be based on the locale set to it and each culture defines its own first day of week values. If needed, the user can set it manually on his own by defining the value through this property. It usually accepts the integer values, whereby 0 is always denoted as Sunday, 1 as Monday and so on.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.Group(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleGroup)
member.summary: Allows to set different resource grouping options on all available schedule view modes.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.HeaderRows(System.Object)
member.summary: Allows defining the collection of custom header rows to display the year, month, week, date and hour label as an individual row on the timeline view of the scheduler.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.Interval(System.Double)
member.summary: It accepts the number value denoting to include the number of days, weeks, workweeks or months on the defined view type.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.IsSelected(System.Boolean)
member.summary: To denote whether the view name given on the `option` is active or not. It acts similar to the `currentView` property and defines the active view of Schedule.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.Option(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.View)
member.summary: It accepts the schedule view name, based on which we can define with its related properties in a single object. The applicable view names are, Day Week WorkWeek Month Agenda MonthAgenda TimelineDay TimelineWeek TimelineWorkWeek TimelineMonth TimelineYear

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.Orientation(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.Orientation)
member.summary: It is used to specify the year view rendering orientation on the schedule.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.ReadOnly(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When set to `true`, displays a quick popup with cell or event details on single clicking over the cells or on events. By default, it is set to `true`. It gets applied only to the view objects on which it is defined.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.ResourceHeaderTemplate(System.String)
member.summary: The template option which is used to render the customized header cells on the schedule. Here, the template accepts either the string or HTMLElement as template design and then the parsed design is displayed onto the header cells. All the resource fields mapped within resources can be accessed within this template code. It gets applied only to the view objects on which it is defined.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.ShowWeekNumber(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When set to `true`, displays the week number of the current view date range.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.ShowWeekend(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When set to `false`, it hides the weekend days of a week from the Schedule. The days which are not defined in the working days collection are usually treated as weekend days. Note: By default, this option is not applicable on `Work Week` view. For example, if the working days are defined as [1, 2, 3, 4], then the remaining days of that week will be considered as the weekend days and will be hidden on all the views.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.StartHour(System.String)
member.summary: It is used to specify the starting hour, from which the Schedule starts to display. It accepts the time string in a short skeleton format and also, hides the time beyond the specified start time.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.TimeScale(Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleTimeScale)
member.summary: Allows to set different timescale configuration on each applicable view modes such as day, week and work week.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleViewBuilder.WorkDays(System.Int32[])
member.summary: It is used to set the working days on schedule. The only days that are defined in this collection will be rendered on the `workWeek` view whereas on other views, it will display all the usual days and simply highlights the working days with different shade.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleWorkHoursBuilder.End(System.String)
member.summary: It accepts the time string in short skeleton format `Hm` and usually denotes the end of the working hour range.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleWorkHoursBuilder.Highlight(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When set to `true`, highlights the cells of working hour range with an active color.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.Schedule.ScheduleWorkHoursBuilder.Start(System.String)
member.summary: It accepts the time string in short skeleton format `Hm` and usually denotes the start of the working hour range.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.Smithchart.RenderType
member.summary: Defines render type of smithchart. They are Impedance - Render a smithchart with Impedance type. Admittance - Render a smithchart with Admittance type.

member.summary: Defines Theme of the smithchart. They are Material - Render a smithchart with Material theme. Fabric - Render a smithchart with Fabric theme

member.summary: Defines the Alignment. They are near - Align the element to the left. center - Align the element to the center. far - Align the element to the right.

member.summary: Defines Theme of the sparkline. They are Material - Render a sparkline with Material theme. Fabric - Render a sparkline with Fabric theme Bootstrap - Render a sparkline with Bootstrap theme HighContrast - Render a sparkline with HighContrast theme

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.WrapMode
member.summary: Defines the wrap mode. Both - Wraps both header and content. Header - Wraps header alone. Content - Wraps content alone.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.EditMode
member.summary: Defines modes of editing.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.RowPosition
member.summary: Defines the position where the new row has to be added.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridAggregateColumn.ColumnName
member.summary: Defines the column name to display the aggregate value. If `columnName` is not defined, then `field` name value will be assigned to the `columnName` property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridAggregateColumn.CustomAggregate
member.summary: Defines a function to calculate custom aggregate value. The `type` value should be set to `custom`. To use custom aggregate value in the template, use the key as `${custom}`. Total aggregation: The custom function will be called with the whole data and the current `AggregateColumn` object. Group aggregation: This will be called with the current group details and the `AggregateColumn` object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridAggregateColumn.Field
member.summary: Defines the column name to perform aggregation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridAggregateColumn.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Defines the footer cell template as a string for the aggregate column. The `type` name should be used to access aggregate values inside the template.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridAggregateColumn.Format
member.summary: Format is applied to a calculated value before it is displayed. Gets the format from the user, which can be standard or custom [`number`](../../../common/internationalization/#supported-format-string) and [`date`](../../../common/internationalization/#supported-format-string-1) formats.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridAggregateColumn.Type
member.summary: Defines the aggregate type of a particular column. To use multiple aggregates for single column, specify the `type` as array. Types of aggregate are, sum average max min count falsecount truecount custom > Specify the `type` value as `custom` to use custom aggregation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridAggregate.Columns
member.summary: Configures the aggregate columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridAggregate.ShowChildSummary
member.summary: Display the childSummary for each parent.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.AllowEditing
member.summary: If `allowEditing` set to false, then it disables editing of a particular column. By default all columns are editable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.AllowFiltering
member.summary: If `allowFiltering` set to false, then it disables filtering option and filter bar element of a particular column. By default all columns are filterable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.AllowReordering
member.summary: If `allowReordering` set to false, then it disables reorder of a particular column. By default all columns can be reorder.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.AllowResizing
member.summary: If `allowResizing` set to false, it disables resize option of a particular column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.AllowSorting
member.summary: If `allowSorting` set to false, then it disables sorting option of a particular column. By default all columns are sortable.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.ClipMode
member.summary: Defines the cell content's overflow mode. The available modes are `Clip` - Truncates the cell content when it overflows its area. `Ellipsis` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area. `EllipsisWithTooltip` - Displays ellipsis when the cell content overflows its area also it will display tooltip while hover on ellipsis applied cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.Columns
member.summary: Used to render multiple header rows(stacked headers) on TreeGrid header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.Commands
member.summary: `commands` provides an option to display command buttons in every cell. The available built-in command buttons are Edit - Edit the record. Delete - Delete the record. Save - Save the record. Cancel - Cancel the edit state.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.CustomAttributes
member.summary: The CSS styles and attributes of the content cells of a particular column can be customized.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.DefaultValue
member.summary: Defines default values for the component when adding a new record to the TreeGrid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.DisableHtmlEncode
member.summary: If `disableHtmlEncode` is set to true, it encodes the HTML of the header and content cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.DisplayAsCheckBox
member.summary: If `displayAsCheckBox` is set to true, it displays the column value as a check box instead of Boolean value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.Edit
member.summary: Defines the `IEditCell` object to customize default edit cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.EditType
member.summary: Defines the type of component for editing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.Field
member.summary: Defines the field name of column which is mapped with mapping name of DataSource. The bounded columns can be sort, filter etc., The `field` name must be a valid JavaScript identifier, the first character must be an alphabet and should not contain spaces and special characters.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.Filter
member.summary: Defines the filter options to customize filtering for the particular column. @default null

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.FilterBarTemplate
member.summary: The `filterBarTemplate` is used to add a custom component instead of default input component for filter bar. It have create and read functions. create: It is used for creating custom components. read: It is used to perform custom filter action.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.Format
member.summary: It is used to change display value with the given format and does not affect the original data. Gets the format from the user which can be standard or custom [`number`](../../../common/internationalization/#supported-format-string) and [`date`](../../../common/internationalization/#supported-format-string-1) formats.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.Formatter
member.summary: Defines the method which is used to achieve custom formatting from an external function. This function triggers before rendering of each cell.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Defines the header template as string or HTML element ID which is used to add customized element in the column header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.HeaderText
member.summary: Defines the header text of column which is used to display in column header. If `headerText` is not defined, then field name value will be assigned to header text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.HeaderTextAlign
member.summary: Define the alignment of column header which is used to align the text of column header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.HideAtMedia
member.summary: Column visibility can change based on [`Media Queries`](http://cssmediaqueries.com/what-are-css-media-queries.html). `hideAtMedia` accepts only valid Media Queries.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.IsFrozen
member.summary: You can use this property to freeze selected columns in grid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.IsIdentity
member.summary: If `isIdentity` is set to true, then this column is considered as identity column.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.IsPrimaryKey
member.summary: If `isPrimaryKey` is set to true, considers this column as the primary key constraint.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.LockColumn

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.MinWidth
member.summary: Defines the minimum width of the column in pixels or percentage.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.ShowCheckbox

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridColumn.Width
member.summary: Defines the width of the column in pixels or percentage.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridEditSettings.AllowAdding
member.summary: If `allowAdding` is set to true, new records can be added to the TreeGrid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridEditSettings.AllowDeleting
member.summary: If `allowDeleting` is set to true, existing record can be deleted from the TreeGrid.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridEditSettings.AllowEditOnDblClick

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridFilterSettings.Columns
member.summary: Specifies the columns to be filtered at initial rendering of the TreeGrid. You can also get the columns that were currently filtered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridFilterSettings.HierarchyMode
member.summary: Defines the filter types. The available options are, `Parent`: Shows the filtered record with parent record. `Child`: Shows the filtered record with child record. `Both` : shows the filtered record with both parent and child record. `None` : Shows only filtered record.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridFilterSettings.IgnoreAccent
member.summary: If ignoreAccent set to true, then filter ignores the diacritic characters or accents while filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridFilterSettings.ImmediateModeDelay
member.summary: Defines the time delay (in milliseconds) in filtering records when the `Immediate` mode of filter bar is set.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridFilterSettings.Mode
member.summary: Defines the filter bar modes. The available options are, `OnEnter`: Initiates filter operation after Enter key is pressed. `Immediate`: Initiates filter operation after a certain time interval. By default, time interval is 1500 ms.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridFilterSettings.Operators
member.summary: The `operators` is used to override the default operators in filter menu. This should be defined by type wise (string, number, date and boolean). Based on the column type, this customize operator list will render in filter menu.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridFilterSettings.ShowFilterBarStatus
member.summary: Shows or hides the filtered status message on the pager.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridFilterSettings.Type
member.summary: Defines options for filtering type. The available options are `Menu` - Specifies the filter type as menu. `FilterBar` - Specifies the filter type as filterbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridFilterSettings.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridPageSettings.PageSize
member.summary: Defines the number of records to be displayed in TreeGrid per page.

member.summary: If `pageSizes` set to true or Array of values, It renders DropDownList in the pager of TreeGrid which allow us to select pageSize from DropDownList.

member.summary: Defines the template which renders customized elements in pager of TreeGrid instead of default elements. It accepts either [template string](../../../common/template-engine/) or HTML element ID.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridSearchSettings.HierarchyMode

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridSearchSettings.IgnoreCase
member.summary: If ignoreCase set to true, then search ignores the diacritic characters or accents while filtering.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridSearchSettings.Key
member.summary: A key word for searching the TreeGrid content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridSearchSettings.Operator
member.summary: Defines the operator to search records. The available operators are:

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridSearchSettings.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridSelectionSettings.CellSelectionMode
member.summary: The cell selection modes are flow and box. It requires the selection [`mode`](#mode) to be either cell or both. `Flow`: Selects the range of cells between start index and end index that also includes the other cells of the selected rows. `Box`: Selects the range of cells within the start and end column indexes that includes in between cells of rows within the range.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridSelectionSettings.CheckboxMode
member.summary: Defines options for checkbox selection Mode. They are `Default`: This is the default value of the checkboxMode. In this mode, user can select multiple rows by clicking rows one by one. `ResetOnRowClick`: In ResetOnRowClick mode, on clicking a row it will reset previously selected row and also multiple rows can be selected by using CTRL or SHIFT key.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridSelectionSettings.CheckboxOnly
member.summary: If 'checkboxOnly' set to true, then the TreeGrid selection is allowed only through checkbox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridSelectionSettings.Mode
member.summary: TreeGrid supports row, cell, and both (row and cell) selection mode.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridSelectionSettings.PersistSelection
member.summary: If 'persistSelection' set to true, then the TreeGrid selection is persisted on all operations. For persisting selection in the TreeGrid, any one of the column should be enabled as a primary key.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridSelectionSettings.Type
member.summary: Defines options for selection type. They are `Single`: Allows selection of only a row or a cell. `Multiple`: Allows selection of multiple rows or cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridSelectionSettings.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridSortSettings.AllowUnsort
member.summary: If `allowUnsort` set to false the user can not get the TreeGrid in unsorted state by clicking the sorted column header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridSortSettings.Columns
member.summary: Specifies the columns to sort at initial rendering of TreeGrid. Also user can get current sorted columns.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridSortSettings.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridTextWrapSettings.WrapMode
member.summary: Defines the `wrapMode` of the TreeGrid. The available modes are: `Both`: Wraps both the header and content. `Content`: Wraps the header alone. `Header`: Wraps the content alone.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridTextWrapSettings.ContentTemplate
member.summary: To get or set value for ContentTemplate.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGrid.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Allows additional HTML attributes such as title, name, etc., and accepts n number of attributes in a key-value pair format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGrid.Aggregates

member.summary: If `allowReordering` is set to true, TreeGrid columns can be reordered. Reordering can be done by drag and drop of a particular column from one index to another index. > If TreeGrid is rendered with stacked headers, reordering is allowed only at the same level as the column headers.

member.summary: If `allowSorting` is set to true, it allows sorting of treegrid records when column header is clicked.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGrid.AllowTextWrap
member.summary: If `allowTextWrap` set to true, then text content will wrap to the next line when its text content exceeds the width of the Column Cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGrid.AutoCheckHierarchy

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGrid.ChildMapping

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGrid.ColumnMenuItems
member.summary:
`columnMenuItems` defines both built-in and custom column menu items.
The available built-in items are, `AutoFitAll` - Auto fit the size of all columns. `AutoFit` - Auto fit the current column. `SortAscending` - Sort the current column in ascending order. `SortDescending` - Sort the current column in descending order. `Filter` - Filter options will show based on filterSettings property like filterbar, menu filter.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGrid.ColumnQueryMode
member.summary: `columnQueryMode`provides options to retrieves data from the data source.Their types are `All`: It retrieves whole data source. `Schema`: retrieves data for all the defined columns in TreeGrid from the data source. `ExcludeHidden`: retrieves data only for visible columns of TreeGrid from the data Source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGrid.Columns
member.summary: Defines the schema of dataSource. If the `columns` declaration is empty or undefined then the `columns` are automatically generated from data source.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGrid.ContextMenuItems
member.summary:
`contextMenuItems` defines both built-in and custom context menu items.
The available built-in items are, `AutoFitAll` - Auto fit the size of all columns. `AutoFit` - Auto fit the current column. `Edit` - Edit the current record. `Delete` - Delete the current record. `Save` - Save the edited record. `Cancel` - Cancel the edited state. `PdfExport` - Export the grid as Pdf format. `ExcelExport` - Export the grid as Excel format. `CsvExport` - Export the grid as CSV format. `SortAscending` - Sort the current column in ascending order. `SortDescending` - Sort the current column in descending order. `FirstPage` - Go to the first page. `PrevPage` - Go to the previous page. `LastPage` - Go to the last page. `NextPage` - Go to the next page.

member.summary: It is used to render TreeGrid table rows.

member.summary: If `enableVirtualization` set to true, then the TreeGrid will render only the rows visible within the view-port and load subsequent rows on vertical scrolling. This helps to load large dataset in TreeGrid.

The available modes are, `Both`: Displays both horizontal and vertical TreeGrid lines. `None`: No TreeGrid lines are displayed. `Horizontal`: Displays the horizontal TreeGrid lines only. `Vertical`: Displays the vertical TreeGrid lines only. `Default`: Displays TreeGrid lines based on the theme.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGrid.Toolbar
member.summary:
`toolbar` defines the ToolBar items of the TreeGrid. It contains built-in and custom toolbar items. If a string value is assigned to the `toolbar` option, it is considered as the template for the whole TreeGrid ToolBar. If an array value is assigned, it is considered as the list of built-in and custom toolbar items in the TreeGrid's Toolbar.
The following code example implements the custom toolbar items.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridAggregateColumnBuilder.ColumnName(System.String)
member.summary: Defines the column name to display the aggregate value. If `columnName` is not defined, then `field` name value will be assigned to the `columnName` property.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridAggregateColumnBuilder.CustomAggregate(System.Object)
member.summary: Defines a function to calculate custom aggregate value. The `type` value should be set to `custom`. To use custom aggregate value in the template, use the key as `${custom}`. Total aggregation: The custom function will be called with the whole data and the current `AggregateColumn` object. Group aggregation: This will be called with the current group details and the `AggregateColumn` object.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridAggregateColumnBuilder.CustomAggregate(System.String)
member.summary: Defines a function to calculate custom aggregate value. The `type` value should be set to `custom`. To use custom aggregate value in the template, use the key as `${custom}`. Total aggregation: The custom function will be called with the whole data and the current `AggregateColumn` object. Group aggregation: This will be called with the current group details and the `AggregateColumn` object.

member.summary: Defines the aggregate type of a particular column. To use multiple aggregates for single column, specify the `type` as array. Types of aggregate are, sum average max min count falsecount truecount custom > Specify the `type` value as `custom` to use custom aggregation.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridBuilder.GridLines(Syncfusion.EJ2.Grids.GridLine)
member.summary: Defines the mode of TreeGrid lines. The available modes are, `Both`: Displays both horizontal and vertical TreeGrid lines. `None`: No TreeGrid lines are displayed. `Horizontal`: Displays the horizontal TreeGrid lines only. `Vertical`: Displays the vertical TreeGrid lines only. `Default`: Displays TreeGrid lines based on the theme.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.EJ2.TreeGrid.TreeGridBuilder.Toolbar(System.Object)
member.summary:
`toolbar` defines the ToolBar items of the TreeGrid. It contains built-in and custom toolbar items. If a string value is assigned to the `toolbar` option, it is considered as the template for the whole TreeGrid ToolBar. If an array value is assigned, it is considered as the list of built-in and custom toolbar items in the TreeGrid's Toolbar.
The following code example implements the custom toolbar items.
